page.title: List of presidential trips made by Barack Obama during 2016

revision.comment: Replaced broken web archive link with a current one from the AP website
revision.text:
{{main|Presidency of Barack Obama}} [[File:President Obama With Cuban President Castro at Estadio Latinoamericano in Havana, Cuba (25370065553).jpg|thumb|President Obama views an exhibition [[baseball game]] with Cuban President [[Raúl Castro]] at [[Estadio Latinoamericano]] during Obama's historic visit to [[Havana]], [[Cuba]], March 22, 2016]] This is a '''list of presidential trips made by [[Barack Obama]] during 2016''', the eighth year of [[Presidency of Barack Obama|his presidency]] as the [[List of Presidents of the United States|44th]] [[President of the United States]]. This list excludes trips made within [[Washington, D.C.]], the U.S. federal capital in which the [[White House]], the official residence and principal workplace of the President, is located. Also excluded are trips to [[Camp David]], the country residence of the President, and to the private home of the [[Family of Barack Obama|Obama family]] in [[Kenwood, Chicago|Kenwood]], [[Chicago]]. == January == {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=70|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- | {{flagicon|Nebraska}} ''[[Nebraska]]'' | [[Omaha, Nebraska|Omaha]],
[[Papillion, Nebraska|Papillion]] | January 13 | President Obama delivered a speech at the [[University of Nebraska Omaha]]'s [[Baxter Arena]] discussing the economic progress the state had made under his leadership and the "agenda for his remaining year — and the years to come — to keep it going," following his final [[2016 State of the Union Address|State of the Union Address]].{{cite news|title=In Nebraska, Obama throws a few more jabs at Trump, Cruz|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/in-nebraska-obama-throws-a-few-more-jabs-at-trump-cruz/|accessdate=January 14, 2016|agency=[[Associated Press]]|work=[[CBS News]]|date=January 13, 2016}} He also visited the city of Papillion to meet with a mother who wrote him a letter last year regarding [[climate change]].{{cite news|last1=Planos|first1=Josh|title=President Obama stops by Papillion home to speak with mother who wrote him letter|url=http://www.ketv.com/news/president-obama-stops-by-papillion-home-to-speak-with-mother-who-wrote-him-letter/37418816|accessdate=January 14, 2016|work=[[KETV]]|publisher=[[American Broadcasting Company]]|date=January 13, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|Louisiana}} ''[[Louisiana]]'' | [[Baton Rouge, Louisiana|Baton Rouge]] | January 13–14 | President Obama participated in a [[town hall meeting]] at [[McKinley High School (Louisiana)|McKinley High School]] discussing the economic progress the state had made under his leadership and the "agenda for his remaining year — and the years to come — to keep it going," following his final State of the Union Address. In his speech, he also touched on the expansion of [[Medicaid]], a day after [[Governor of Louisiana|Louisiana Governor]] [[John Bel Edwards]] signed an executive order allowing access to the [[health insurance]] program in the state.{{cite news|last1=O'Donoghue|first1=Julia|title=Barack Obama, John Bel Edwards talk Medicaid expansion in Louisiana|url=http://www.nola.com/politics/index.ssf/2016/01/barack_obama_john_bel_edwards.html|accessdate=January 15, 2016|work=[[The Times-Picayune]]|date=January 13, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|Michigan}} ''[[Michigan]]'' | [[Detroit]] | January 20 | President Obama visited the [[North American International Auto Show#2016|2016 North American International Auto Show]] in Detroit, following the announcement in his [[Weekly Radio Address of the President of the United States|Weekly Radio Address]].{{cite news|title=U.S. President Barack Obama to visit the Detroit auto show this month|url=http://windsorstar.com/storyline/u-s-president-barack-obama-to-to-visit-the-detroit-auto-show-this-month|accessdate=January 10, 2016|work=[[Windsor Star]]|date=January 9, 2016}} |} == February == {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=70|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- | {{flagicon|Maryland}} ''[[Maryland]]'' | [[Baltimore]] | February 3 | President Obama visited the [[Islamic Society of Baltimore]] in [[Catonsville, Maryland|Catonsville]], marking his first presidential visit to a [[List of mosques in the United States|mosque in the United States]].{{cite news|last1=Fritze|first1=John|last2=Duncan|first2=Ian|title=President Obama at Maryland mosque: 'You fit in here'|url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/politics/bs-md-obama-mosque-visit-20160203-story.html|accessdate=February 4, 2016|work=[[The Baltimore Sun]]|date=February 3, 2016}}{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/acts-of-faith/wp/2016/02/03/president-obamas-mosque-visit-will-spotlight-a-new-generation-of-muslim-americans/ |publisher=''[[Washington Post]]'' |title=At Baltimore mosque, President Obama encourages U.S. Muslims: ‘You fit in here’ |date=February 3, 2016 |first=Michelle |last=Boorstein |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160309054234/https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/acts-of-faith/wp/2016/02/03/president-obamas-mosque-visit-will-spotlight-a-new-generation-of-muslim-americans/ |archive-date=March 9, 2016 |deadurl=yes |df= }} |- | {{flagicon|Illinois}} ''[[Illinois]]'' | [[Springfield, Illinois|Springfield]] | February 10 | President Obama addressed the [[Illinois General Assembly]], commemorating nine years since the launch of his [[Barack Obama presidential campaign, 2008|presidential campaign]].{{cite news|last1=Finke|first1=Doug|last2=Munks|first2=Jamie|title=President Obama to address Illinois General Assembly on Feb. 10|url=http://www.sj-r.com/news/20160129/president-obama-to-address-illinois-general-assembly-on-feb-10|accessdate=February 1, 2016|work=[[The State Journal-Register]]|date=January 29, 2016}} The president also attended a private event at the [[Hoogland Center for the Arts]].{{cite news|last1=Hess|first1=Lindsey|title=President Obama Thanks Supporters At Hoogland Center For The Arts|url=http://foxillinois.com/news/local/president-obama-thanks-supporters-at-hoogland-center-for-the-arts-02-11-2016|accessdate=February 14, 2016|work=[[WRSP-TV]]|publisher=[[Fox Broadcasting Company]]|date=February 11, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|California}} ''[[California]]'' | [[San Francisco Bay Area]],
[[Greater Los Angeles Area|Los Angeles]],
[[Coachella Valley]] | February 10–16 | On the evening of February 10, President Obama arrived at [[Moffett Federal Airfield]] in [[Mountain View, California|Mountain View]] and attended two [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]] fundraisers for Democrats running in the [[United States Senate elections, 2016|U.S. Senate elections, 2016]] in [[Palo Alto, California|Palo Alto]] and [[Atherton, California|Atherton]], the following day.{{cite news|last1=Artz|first1=Matthew|last2=Lee|first2=Jacqueline|title=Obama sweeps through Silicon Valley to raise cash|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/california/ci_29505327/obama-shows-up-downtown-palo-alto-surprises-residents?source=infinite-up|accessdate=February 14, 2016|work=[[San Jose Mercury News]]|date=February 11, 2016}} Later that afternoon, President Obama departed the Bay Area arrived in Los Angeles and headed to [[Burbank, California|Burbank]] to tape his appearance on ''[[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]]''.{{cite news|author1=[[Mark Landler|Landler, Mark]]|title=Obama, on ‘Ellen DeGeneres Show,’ Recites Poetry and Reflects on Presidency|url=https://www.nytimes.com/politics/first-draft/2016/02/12/obama-recites-poetry-and-turns-wistful-on-the-ellen-degeneres-show/?_r=0|accessdate=February 14, 2016|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=February 14, 2016}} He then attended two fundraisers organized by the [[Democratic National Committee]] in [[Hancock Park, Los Angeles|Hancock Park]].{{cite news|last1=Wire|first1=Sarah|title=Obama raises money with John Legend at Los Angeles fundraiser|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/tv/showtracker/la-pol-ca-obama-fundraiser-john-legend-traffic-20160211-story.html|accessdate=February 14, 2016|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=February 11, 2016}} On February 12, Obama flew to [[Palm Springs, California|Palm Springs]], where he designated three [[National Monument (United States)|National Monuments]]: [[Castle Mountains National Monument]], [[Mojave Trails National Monument]], and [[Sand to Snow National Monument]]. He spent his weekend in [[Rancho Mirage, California|Rancho Mirage]].{{cite news|title=President Obama makes sixth trip to the desert, golfs|url=http://www.desertsun.com/story/news/2016/02/12/how-to-see-air-force-one-land/80287356/|accessdate=February 14, 2016|work=[[The Desert Sun]]|date=February 12, 2016}} On the evening of February 13, President Obama delivered a statement on the death of [[Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States|Associate Justice]] [[Antonin Scalia]].{{cite news|last1=Bertrand|first1=Natasha|title=OBAMA: 'I plan to fulfill my constitutional responsibility to nominate a successor' to Scalia 'in due time'|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/obama-statement-scalia-death-dead-2016-2|accessdate=February 14, 2016|work=[[Business Insider]]|date=February 14, 2016}} On February 15–16, President Obama hosted the U.S.-ASEAN Summit with the leaders of the [[Association of Southeast Asian Nations]] at the [[Sunnylands]] estate in Rancho Mirage. According to a statement released by the [[White House]], the summit was aimed at strengthening cooperation on "political, security, and economic issues" between the United States and the [[Member states of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations|ASEAN member states]] under the U.S.-ASEAN strategic partnership signed in November 2015.{{cite news|title=US sets February date for ASEAN summit in California|url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asiapacific/us-sets-february-date-for/2388634.html|accessdate=December 31, 2015|work=[[Channel NewsAsia]]|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=[[MediaCorp]]|date=December 31, 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151231084546/http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asiapacific/us-sets-february-date-for/2388634.html|archivedate=December 31, 2015|df=}}{{cite news|title=Obama will host the US-ASEAN Summit in Rancho Mirage, California on February 15–16.|url=http://sputniknews.com/us/20151230/1032521741/obama-hold-us-asean-rancho-mirage.html|accessdate=December 31, 2015|agency=[[Sputnik (news agency)|Sputnik]]|date=December 30, 2015}}{{cite web|title=Statement by the Press Secretary on the U.S.-ASEAN Summit|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2015/12/30/statement-press-secretary-us-asean-summit|publisher=[[White House Office of the Press Secretary]]|accessdate=December 31, 2015|date=December 30, 2015}} |- | {{flagicon|Florida}} ''[[Florida]]'' | [[Jacksonville, Florida|Jacksonville]] | February 26 | President Obama toured the facilities of the [[Saft Groupe S.A.|Saft America Advanced Battery]] plant at Jacksonville's [[Cecil Commerce Center]] to tout the [[American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009]], to which Saft America won a $95.5 million grant which they used to build their facilities.{{cite news|last1=Monroe|first1=Nate|last2=Bauerlein|first2=David|last3=Hong|first3=Christopher|title=President Obama looks to Jacksonville firm during visit to validate his legacy|url=http://jacksonville.com/news/metro/2016-02-26/story/president-obama-looks-jacksonville-firm-during-visit-validate-his-legacy|accessdate=March 1, 2016|work=[[The Florida Times-Union]]|date=February 26, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Superville|first1=Darlene|title=Obama in Florida will tout benefits of economic stimulus|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/2016/02/26/obama-florida-will-tout-benefits-economic-stimulus/80983976/|accessdate=March 6, 2016|work=[[USA Today]]|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=February 26, 2016}} |} == March == {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=70|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- | {{flagicon|Wisconsin}} ''[[Wisconsin]]'' | [[Milwaukee]] | March 3 | President Obama delivered a speech at Milwaukee's United Community Center to applaud the city's achievements in increasing the number of enrollees under the [[Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act]] after the city won a competition organized by the White House among 20 cities.{{cite news|title=Obama to visit Milwaukee to praise health insurance sign-ups|url=http://www.startribune.com/obama-to-visit-milwaukee-to-praise-health-insurance-sign-ups/370569141/|accessdate=March 1, 2016|work=[[Star Tribune]]|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=February 29, 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304085502/http://www.startribune.com/obama-to-visit-milwaukee-to-praise-health-insurance-sign-ups/370569141/|archivedate=March 4, 2016|df=}}{{cite news|title=Obama cites gains in health coverage during Milwaukee visit|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/midwest/ct-obama-milwaukee-visit-20160303-story.html|accessdate=March 6, 2016|work=[[Chicago Tribune]]|date=March 3, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|Texas}} ''[[Texas]]'' | [[Austin, Texas|Austin]],
[[Dallas]] | March 11–12 | President Obama participated in a 45-minute [[keynote]] interview with ''[[The Texas Tribune]]'' editor-in-chief [[Evan Smith (journalist)|Evan Smith]] regarding the usage of technology in [[civic engagement]] at the annual [[South by Southwest#SXSW Interactive|South by Southwest Interactive]] conference, held at the [[Long Center for the Performing Arts]] in Austin.{{cite web|last1=Setoodeh|first1=Ramin|title=President Barack Obama at SXSW: It’s ‘Easier to Order a Pizza Than Vote’|url=https://variety.com/2016/film/news/obama-sxsw-keynote-speech-video-1201728300/|publisher=''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]''|accessdate=March 12, 2016|date=March 11, 2016}} He also attended a Democratic Party fundraiser at the Austin Music Hall, as well as a private dinner-fundraiser,{{cite news|last1=Ward|first1=Mike|title=Obama’s appearance could mean Austin gridlock at SXSW|url=http://www.expressnews.com/news/local/article/Obama-s-appearance-could-mean-Austin-gridlock-6883320.php|accessdate=March 12, 2016|work=[[San Antonio Express-News]]|date=March 10, 2016}} before flying to Dallas to attend fundraisers for the Democratic National Committee.{{cite news|last1=Jeffers|first1=Gromer Jr.|title=Obama to be at Gilley’s in Dallas for private fundraiser Saturday|url=http://trailblazersblog.dallasnews.com/2016/03/president-obama-at-gilleys-for-dnc-fundraiser-as-part-of-dallas-campaign-stop.html/|accessdate=March 12, 2016|work=[[The Dallas Morning News]]|date=March 11, 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160312131157/http://trailblazersblog.dallasnews.com/2016/03/president-obama-at-gilleys-for-dnc-fundraiser-as-part-of-dallas-campaign-stop.html/|archivedate=March 12, 2016|df=}} |- | {{flagicon|Cuba}} [[Cuba]] | [[Havana]] | March 20–22 | On February 18, 2016, a [[White House]] official announced that President Obama would undertake a historic visit to Cuba on March 20–22 to mark [[United States–Cuban Thaw|the end of the 54-year tensions]] in [[Cuba–United States relations]], becoming the first sitting U.S. president to visit Cuba since [[Calvin Coolidge]] in 1928. In an interview with [[Yahoo! News]] in December 2015, President Obama said that he would only visit Cuba if he could meet with the [[Cuban dissident movement]], saying: "If I go on a visit, then part of the deal is that I get to talk to everybody, I’ve made very clear in my conversations directly with [[President of Cuba|President]] [[Raúl Castro]] that we would continue to reach out to those who want to broaden the scope for, you know, free expression inside of Cuba."{{cite news|last1=Allen|first1=Ron|last2=Johnson|first2=Alex|title=President Obama to Make Historic Visit to Cuba, U.S. Official Says|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/president-obama-make-historic-visit-cuba-u-s-official-says-n520461|accessdate=February 18, 2016|work=[[NBC News]]|date=February 18, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Knox|first1=Olivier|title=Obama to travel to Cuba in March|url=https://www.yahoo.com/politics/obama-to-travel-to-cuba-in-march-reports-022334808.html|accessdate=February 18, 2016|work=[[Yahoo! News]]|date=February 18, 2016}} Hours before the President and the First Family's arrival, the weekly demonstration by protesters from more than 50 [[Ladies in White]] [[human rights activists]] and other opposition groups, hoping for the President's awareness of "women fighting for the liberty of [[Human rights in Cuba#Political repression|political prisoners]]," were cleared by [[Law enforcement in Cuba|Cuban police]] in the Havana neighborhood of [[Miramar, Havana|Miramar]].{{cite news|last1=Watts|first1=Jonathan|title='The oppression is high': Cuban police break up protest ahead of Obama's visit|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/mar/20/cuba-obama-visit-anti-castro-protesters-clash|accessdate=March 21, 2016|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=March 20, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Gomez|first1=Alan|title=Cuba arrests dozens of human rights protesters before Obama's arrival|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2016/03/20/cuba-dissidents-protesters-arrested-president-obama-visit/82048950/|accessdate=March 21, 2016|work=[[USA Today]]|date=March 20, 2016}} President Obama and the First Family arrived in Havana's [[José Martí International Airport]] on the rainy afternoon of Sunday, March 20, where they were greeted by Cuban officials led by [[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Cuba)|Foreign Minister]] [[Bruno Rodríguez Parrilla]].{{cite news|last1=Spetalnick|first1=Matt|last2=Trotta|first2=Daniel|last3=Mason|first3=Jeff|title=Obama in Cuba on historic visit|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-cuba-idUSKCN0WM04H|accessdate=March 21, 2016|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=March 20, 2016}} The First Family first headed to the Meliá Habana Hotel to meet with the staff of the newly reopened [[Embassy of the United States, Havana|U.S. Embassy in Havana]] and their families.{{cite news|last1=Johnson|first1=Alex|title='¡Muchas Gracias!': 'Yes We Did!' Obama Declares in Cuba|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/muchas-gracias-yes-we-did-obama-declares-cuba-embassy-n542326|accessdate=March 21, 2016|work=[[NBC News]]|date=March 20, 2016}}{{cite news|title=Obama lands in Cuba, tells U.S. Embassy staff he is making 'historic visit'|url=http://www.nola.com/news/index.ssf/2016/03/obama_lands_in_cuba_tells_us_e.html|accessdate=March 21, 2016|work=[[The Times-Picayune]]|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=March 20, 2016}} The Obamas later completed a walking tour of [[Old Havana]] (guided by Havana historian [[Eusebio Leal]]), visiting the [[Plaza de Armas]], the [[Palacio de los Capitanes Generales]], and the [[Havana Cathedral]].{{cite news|title=Obama and family tour Cuba's historic Old Havana|url=http://www.jpost.com/Breaking-News/Obama-and-family-tour-Cubas-historic-Old-Havana-448625|accessdate=March 21, 2016|work=[[The Jerusalem Post]]|date=March 21, 2016}} At the Havana Cathedral, they met with [[Jaime Lucas Ortega y Alamino|Cardinal Jaime Ortega]], the [[Roman Catholic Archdiocese of San Cristóbal de la Habana|Archbishop of Havana]], who along with [[Pope Francis]] and the [[Holy See]] helped normalize and restore Cuba–United States relations.{{cite news|title=Barack Obama begins 'historic' 3-day visit to Cuba|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/world/obama-cuba-baseball-robinson-1.3499801|accessdate=March 21, 2016|work=[[CBC News]]|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=[[Canadian Broadcasting Corporation]]|date=March 20, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=de Córdoba|first1=José|title=Obama to Meet Cardinal Jaime Ortega at Havana Cathedral|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/obama-to-meet-cardinal-jaime-ortega-at-havana-cathedral-1458493209|accessdate=March 21, 2016|work=[[Wall Street Journal]]|date=March 20, 2016}} In the evening, the Obamas dined at a local [[paladar]] in central Havana.{{cite news|title=Where the Obama’s had Dinner on their First Night in Cuba|url=http://www.havanatimes.org/?p=117502|accessdate=March 21, 2016|work=[[Havana Times]]|date=March 20, 2016}} President Obama began his Monday, March 21, by paying his respects to Cuban national hero [[José Martí]] during a brief wreath-laying ceremony at his [[José Martí Memorial|memorial]] at Havana's [[Plaza de la Revolución]].{{cite news|title=President Obama Praises Jose Marti's 'Passion for Liberty'|url=http://www.nbcmiami.com/news/local/President-Obama-Praises-Cuban-Jose-Martis-Passion-for-Liberty-372954961.html|accessdate=March 22, 2016|work=[[WTVJ]]|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=[[NBC News]]|date=March 21, 2016}} He then headed to the [[Museum of the Revolution (Cuba)|Palace of the Revolution]] to meet with his Cuban counterpart, President Raúl Castro, where he was given a welcome ceremony before the two heads of state began their official talks. During their meeting, the two presidents pledged to work towards a "new path" in reconciling their two countries' relations amid their differences in [[Human rights in Cuba|human rights]] and democracy.{{cite news|last1=Lederman|first1=Josh|title=President Obama, Raul Castro tussle over human rights|url=https://www.bostonglobe.com/news/nation/2016/03/21/president-obama-raul-castro-set-for-historic-meeting/N7yQcfe49cKq5PKFXN2S1N/story.html|accessdate=March 22, 2016|work=[[The Boston Globe]]|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=March 21, 2016}} U.S. Secretaries [[John Kerry]] and [[Penny Pritzker]] of [[United States Secretary of State|State]] and [[United States Secretary of Commerce|Commerce]], respectively, were in attendance, while [[Vice President of Cuba|Vice President]] [[Miguel Díaz-Canel]] and Foreign Minister Bruno Rodríguez Parrilla were among the several [[Council of Ministers (Cuba)|Cuban Council of Ministers]] who participated in the discussions.{{cite news|title=Cuba President Raul Castro Welcomes US Counterpart Barack Obama|url=http://en.escambray.cu/2016/cuba-president-raul-castro-welcomes-us-counterpart-barack-obama/|accessdate=March 22, 2016|work=[[Escambray (newspaper)|Escambray]]|agency=[[Prensa Latina]]|date=March 21, 2016}} The two leaders later participated in a joint press conference, where President Obama declared a "new day" in Cuba–U.S. relations but acknowledged President Castro's statement regarding the "profound differences" between their two countries regarding human rights and democracy, which Obama criticized. Obama also added that the [[United States embargo against Cuba|embargo against Cuba]] and the [[Guantanamo Bay Naval Base]] continue to be obstructions in the normalization and restoration of the two countries' relations, wherein Castro responded saying that it would be "the most important obstacle to our economic development and the well-being of the Cuban people." In addition, Castro criticized the U.S.' demand for a human rights reform in Cuba, saying that "Cuba believes civil, political, economic, social and cultural rights are universal" and later adding that Cuba opposes "political manipulation and double standards in the approach to human rights." When asked by [[CNN]]'s [[Jim Acosta]] about political prisoners in Cuba, Castro denied knowledge of such, insisting that his government only holds spies, terrorists and armed [[insurrectionist]]s, and demanded for a list to be released.{{cite news|last1=Phelps|first1=Jordyn|title=President Obama and Cuban President Clash on Political Prisoners in Cuba|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/president-obama-heralds-day-us-cuban-relations/story?id=37755816|accessdate=March 22, 2016|work=[[ABC News]]|date=March 21, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Alexander|first1=Harriet|title=President Raul Castro criticises US demands for human rights reform|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/centralamericaandthecaribbean/cuba/12200214/Watch-live-President-Barack-Obama-meets-President-Raul-Castro-in-historic-Cuba-visit.html|accessdate=March 22, 2016|work=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|date=March 21, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Lee|first1=Carol|title=Barack Obama, Raul Castro admit serious differences amid Cuba visit|url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/business/wall-street-journal/barack-obama-raul-castro-admit-serious-differences-amid-cuba-visit/news-story/4310774fe9d8a44262af6dcfe1ff79cc|accessdate=March 22, 2016|work=[[The Australian]]|date=March 22, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Davis|first1=Julie Hirschfield|last2=Cave|first2=Damien|title=Cuba Meeting Between Obama and Castro Exposes Old Grievances|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/03/22/world/americas/obama-and-raul-castro-to-meet-in-pivotal-moment-for-us-cuba-thaw.html?_r=0|accessdate=March 22, 2016|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=March 22, 2016}} Later in the afternoon, President Obama attended an event with U.S. and Cuban entrepreneurs that would allow for the exploration of opportunities between the two countries' businesses at an effort to enhance Cuba's [[private sector]] and encourage the discontinuation of the trade embargo against Cuba amidst the country's [[State-owned enterprise|state-owned]]-dominated [[Economy of Cuba|economy]]. During the event, Obama urged the rehabilitation of the [[Infrastructure of Cuba|country's infrastructure]] to allow for better transportation of goods, [[Wholesale marketing of food|wholesale marketing]] to help [[small business]] owners, and the unification of the country's dual-currency system (the [[Cuban peso]] and the [[Cuban convertible peso]]), all to improve Cuba's economy.{{cite news|title=Barack Obama brings message of change to Cuba, meeting with Raul Castro|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/world/cuba-obama-1.3500321|accessdate=March 22, 2016|work=[[CBC News]]|publisher=[[Canadian Broadcasting Corporation]]|date=March 21, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Whitman|first1=Elizabeth|title=As Obama Visits Cuba, These Business Execs And Entrepreneurs Are Following, Eager To Explore Opportunities|url=http://www.ibtimes.com/obama-visits-cuba-these-business-execs-entrepreneurs-are-following-eager-explore-2340325|accessdate=March 22, 2016|work=[[International Business Times]]|date=March 21, 2016}} In the evening, President Castro treated President Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama to a state dinner at the Palace of the Revolution.{{cite news|last1=Hansler|first1=Jennifer|title=President Obama and First Family Attend State Dinner in Cuba|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Photos/president-obama-family-attend-state-dinner-cuba/story?id=37823834|accessdate=March 22, 2016|work=[[ABC News]]|date=March 21, 2016}} Secretary of State John Kerry, Secretary of Commerce Penny Pritzker, [[United States House of Representatives|House]] [[Party leaders of the United States House of Representatives|Minority Leader]] [[Nancy Pelosi]], [[Senior Advisor to the President of the United States|Senior Advisor]] [[Valerie Jarrett]], First Lady Chief of Staff [[Tina Tchen]], [[United States Senate|Senator]] [[Patrick Leahy]], and [[United States House of Representatives|Representative]] [[Charles Rangel]] of [[New York's 13th congressional district]] were among the American entourage who attended the state dinner.{{cite news|last1=de Graaf|first1=Mia|last2=Chambers|first2=Francesca|title=Havana ball! Barack and Michelle Obama sit down for mojito-spiked mousse and rum-drenched soup at state dinner with Cuban president Raul Castro|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3503591/Obamas-arrive-Cuban-state-dinner.html|accessdate=March 22, 2016|work=[[Daily Mail]]|date=March 22, 2016}} On the morning of his final day in Cuba, Tuesday, March 22, President Obama addressed the Cuban people on [[Television in Cuba|national television]] from the [[Gran Teatro de La Habana]], along Havana's [[Paseo del Prado, Havana|Paseo del Prado]]. President Castro was among the Cubans in attendance at the theater. He began his remarks by responding to the [[2016 Brussels bombings|Brussels bombings]] that occurred several hours prior, which he condemned, saying: "We can and we will defeat those who threaten the safety and security of people all around the world," and added that the attacks were a reminder "that the world must unite in fighting against the scourge of terrorism."{{cite news|last1=Lederman|first1=Josh|last2=Caldwell|first2=Alicia C.|title=Obama pledges US support to Belgium after attacks|url=http://www.seattletimes.com/nation-world/nation-politics/in-cuba-obama-briefed-on-brussels-attacks/|accessdate=March 23, 2016|work=[[The Seattle Times]]|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=March 22, 2016}} Obama then transitioned to his speech regarding "a new chapter" in Cuba's relations with the United States and the Western Hemisphere, saying that he visited the country to "bury the last remnants of the [[Cold War]] in the Americas" and to "extend the hand of friendship to the Cuban people." He called on the [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] to lift the U.S. embargo against Cuba, saying that "it is an outdated burden on the Cuban people" and a "burden on the Americans who want to work and do business or invest here in Cuba." Obama also touched on the importance of Cubans being able to "realize their potential," as they would not "without continued change in Cuba," urging the removal of the country's two-currency system and the access of the [[Internet in Cuba|Internet all across Cuba]]. Speaking for democracy to be "embraced" in Cuba, saying that it "allows for the fullest expression of the ideals of any revolution" and "gives individuals the capacity to be catalysts," he appealed for [[political freedom]] within Cubans, including the right of [[freedom of speech]], [[Religion in Cuba|religion]] and [[criticism of government]].{{cite news|last1=Gaouette|first1=Nicole|title=Obama calls for change and freedom in Cuba|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2016/03/22/politics/obama-cuba-change-speech-embargo/index.html|accessdate=March 23, 2016|work=[[CNN]]|date=March 22, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Usborne|first1=David|title=Barack Obama calls on Cuba to embrace democracy and roll back political repression|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/president-barack-obama-calls-on-cuba-to-embrace-democracy-and-roll-back-political-repression-a6946281.html|accessdate=March 23, 2016|work=[[The Independent]]|date=March 23, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Mason|first1=Jeff|last2=Spetalnick|first2=Matt|title=Obama appeals for political freedoms in speech to Cubans|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-cuba-idUSKCN0WO0EA|accessdate=March 23, 2016|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=March 22, 2016}} Obama also referenced several American and Cuban historical figures during his speech, including Cuban national hero José Martí, writer [[Ernest Hemingway]], [[baseball]] legend [[Jackie Robinson]], and singer [[Gloria Estefan]].{{cite news|last1=Korte|first1=Gregory|title=In speech to Cubans, Obama seeks to bury Cold War rivalry|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2016/03/22/obama-addresses-cuban-people-both-island-and-us/82103344/|accessdate=March 23, 2016|work=[[USA Today]]|date=March 22, 2016}} Before noon, President Obama headed to the U.S. Embassy in Havana that opened in July 2015 to meet with various Cuban dissidents and leaders of civil society organizations, praising them for their "extraordinary courage" in their fight for "democracy, freedom of speech, worship or assembly" in Cuba and expressed hope that their efforts and ideas will help shape [[Foreign policy of the United States|U.S. foreign policy]].{{cite news|title=President Obama Praises Courage of Cuban Dissidents|url=http://www.nbcmiami.com/news/local/President-Obama-Praises-Courage-of-Cuban-Dissidents-373097931.html|accessdate=March 23, 2016|work=[[WTVJ]]|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=[[NBC News]]|date=March 22, 2016}} Among the dissidents and the leaders of the Cuban civil society that attended the [[round table discussion]] were [[Guillermo Fariñas]], [[Dagoberto Valdés Hernández]], Ladies in White leader [[Berta Soler]], [[Antonio Rodiles]], and [[Elizardo Sánchez]].{{cite news|title=Obama Praises "Courage" of Dissidents|url=http://www.havanatimes.org/?p=117582|accessdate=March 23, 2016|work=[[Havana Times]]|date=March 22, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Wilkinson|first1=Tracy|title=What you need to know about the Cuban dissidents who met with Obama|url=http://www.latimes.com/world/mexico-americas/la-fg-cuban-dissidents-obama-20160322-htmlstory.html|accessdate=March 23, 2016|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=March 22, 2016}} In the afternoon, the First Family and President Castro attended an [[Exhibition game|exhibition]] [[baseball]] game between the [[Tampa Bay Rays]] and the [[Cuba national baseball team]] at the [[Estadio Latinoamericano]] that was also attended by around 55,000 Cuban and American baseball fans. The Obamas were accompanied by [[Rachel Robinson]], the widow of baseball player Jackie Robinson who trained in Cuba with the [[Brooklyn Dodgers]] in 1947.{{cite news|last1=Buncombe|first1=Andrew|title=Barack Obama does 'The Wave' with Raul Castro at historic Cuba baseball game|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/barack-obama-does-the-wave-with-raul-castro-at-historic-baseball-game-a6947006.html|accessdate=March 23, 2016|work=[[The Independent]]|date=March 23, 2016}} The Rays won the game 4–1.{{cite web|title=Rays beat Cuban team with Barack Obama, Raul Castro in attendance|url=http://espn.go.com/mlb/story/_/id/15045394/tampa-bay-rays-beat-cuban-national-team-landmark-game|publisher=[[ESPN]]|accessdate=March 23, 2016|date=March 22, 2016}} After the game, the Obamas headed to Havana's José Martí International Airport to depart Cuba for Buenos Aires, Argentina, where they were sent-off by President Castro, ending their three-day historic visit.{{cite news|title=Cuban President Raul Castro shows up at tarmac to send President Barack Obama off from Cuba |url=https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2016-03-22/the-latest-heavy-security-ahead-of-obama-speech-in-havana |accessdate=March 23, 2016 |work=[[U.S. News & World Report]] |agency=[[Associated Press]] |date=March 22, 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160323105532/http://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2016-03-22/the-latest-heavy-security-ahead-of-obama-speech-in-havana |archivedate=March 23, 2016 |df= }} |- |{{Flag|Argentina}} |[[Buenos Aires]],
[[Bariloche]] |March 23–24 |On February 18, 2016, a [[White House]] official announced that President Obama would undertake a state visit to Argentina on March 23–24, 2016 to improve the [[Argentina–United States relations]] under the administration of newly elected [[President of Argentina|Argentine president]], [[Mauricio Macri]], after the two countries' relations under predecessors [[Cristina Fernández de Kirchner]] and [[Néstor Kirchner]] saw tension in trade and investment.{{cite web|title=Statement by the Press Secretary on the President’s Travel to Cuba and Argentina|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2016/02/18/statement-press-secretary-presidents-travel-cuba-and-argentina|publisher=[[White House Office of the Press Secretary]]|accessdate=March 23, 2016|date=February 18, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Gilbert|first1=Jonathan|title=President Obama's Argentina Visit Is All About Trade|url=http://fortune.com/2016/03/23/obama-argentina-macri-trade/|accessdate=March 23, 2016|work=[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]|date=March 23, 2016}} President Obama and the First Family arrived in Buenos Aires' [[Ministro Pistarini International Airport]] from Havana, Cuba at around 1:10 a.m. ([[UTC−03:00|UTC−3]]) on Wednesday, March 23, where they were greeted by [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Worship|Argentine Foreign Minister]] [[Susana Malcorra]].{{cite news|last1=Bronstein|first1=Hugh|last2=Lough|first2=Richard|title=Obama in Argentina to reset relations amid regional political shift|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-argentina-idUSKCN0WP0B3|accessdate=March 23, 2016|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=March 23, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Lahrichi|first1=Kamilia|title=Under heavy security, Obama touches down in Argentina in historic state visit|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2016/03/23/obama-lands-argentina/82151328/|accessdate=March 23, 2016|work=[[USA Today]]|date=March 23, 2016}} Later that morning, President Obama headed to the [[Casa Rosada]] for a bilateral meeting and a joint press conference with President Macri. Obama and Macri discussed ways to strengthen cooperation in promoting "[[universal value]]s and interests," such as in the areas of security, energy, health and human rights, where the two presidents have agreed for [[List of federal agencies in the United States|U.S. federal agencies]] to assist [[Terrorism in Argentina#Responses and counterterrorism efforts|Argentina's counter-terrorism efforts]], to contribute to [[peacekeeping]] missions, combat [[illegal drug trade]] and [[organized crime]], respond to diseases and [[outbreak]]s like the [[Zika virus outbreak (2015–present)|Zika virus]], and develop resources and [[renewable energy]] strategies.{{cite web|title=Remarks by President Obama and President Macri of Argentina in Joint Press Conference|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2016/03/23/remarks-president-obama-and-president-macri-argentina-joint-press|publisher=[[White House Office of the Press Secretary]]|accessdate=March 24, 2016|date=March 23, 2016}} Obama also praised Macri for his economic reforms that helped create "sustainable and [[Inclusive growth|inclusive]] [[economic growth]]" and "reconnected Argentina with the [[world economy]]."{{cite news|title=Obama: 'Macri moved rapidly to reconnect Argentina with the global economy'|url=http://www.buenosairesherald.com/article/211261/macri-obama-hold-joint-press-conference-after-meeting-at-pink-house-|accessdate=March 24, 2016|work=[[Buenos Aires Herald]]|date=March 23, 2016}} Thus, Obama declared a "fresh era" of relations that would help Argentina's credibility in the Latin American region and the world, and announced trade and economic initiatives to reset the countries' relations after years of tension.{{cite news|last1=Davis|first1=Julie Hirschfield|last2=Gilbert|first2=Jonathan|title=Obama Declares a New Partnership After Talks With Argentine Leader|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/03/24/world/americas/obama-argentina-president-mauricio-macri-brussels-attacks.html?_r=0|accessdate=March 24, 2016|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=March 23, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Lee|first1=Carol E.|last2=Turner|first2=Taos|title=Obama and Argentine President Mauricio Macri Reset Bilateral Ties|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-image-improving-but-still-weak-as-obama-visits-argentina-1458744473|accessdate=March 24, 2016|work=[[The Wall Street Journal]]|date=March 23, 2016}} Foreign Minister Malcorra announced that Argentina signed agreements with the U.S. to join again on the [[Visa Waiver Program]]. Argentina initially joined on the program in 1996, but was removed in 2002.{{cite news|title=Malcorra confirmó que Argentina firmó un acuerdo con EE.UU. "para iniciar el proceso de eliminación de la visa"|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1883060-susana-malcorra-barack-obama-visa-eeuu|accessdate=March 24, 2016|work=[[La Nación (Buenos Aires)|La Nación]]|date=March 24, 2016}}{{cite news|title=Malcorra ratificó avances para eliminar el visado para ingresar a los EE.UU.|url=http://www.perfil.com/politica/Malcorra-ratifico-avances-para-eliminar-el-visado-para-ingresar-a-los-EE.UU.-20160324-0022.html|accessdate=March 24, 2016|work=[[Perfil]]|date=March 24, 2016}}{{cite news|title=Argentineans May No Longer Need a Visa to Enter the US|url=https://panampost.com/raquel-garcia/2016/03/15/argentineans-to-no-longer-need-us-visa/|accessdate=March 24, 2016|work=[[PanAm Post]]|date=March 15, 2016}} In the afternoon, President Obama visited the [[Buenos Aires Metropolitan Cathedral]] to lay a wreath at the tomb of Argentine general [[José de San Martín]], who was known for his role as a ''[[Libertadores|Libertador]]'' in the [[Spanish American wars of independence]] and is considered the [[Folk hero|national hero]] of Argentina. There, he also met with Cardinal [[Mario Aurelio Poli]], the [[Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Buenos Aires|Archbishop of Buenos Aires]] who replaced Cardinal Jorge Bergoglio when he was elected as [[Pope Francis]]. Obama then headed to the [[:es:Usina del Arte|Usina del Arte]] to hold a town hall meeting with young Argentine leaders.{{cite news|title=The Latest: Obama holds town hall with Argentine youth|url=http://m.uticaod.com/news/20160323/latest-obama-holds-town-hall-with-argentine-youth|accessdate=March 25, 2016|work=[[Observer-Dispatch]]|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=March 23, 2016}} In the evening, President Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama attended a state dinner hosted by President Macri and [[First Ladies and Gentlemen of Argentina|First Lady]] [[Juliana Awada]] at the [[Néstor Kirchner Cultural Centre]], where both Obamas were treated with a [[tango]] dance.{{cite news|title=President Obama Does the Tango at Argentina State Dinner|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/president-obama-does-tango-at-877992|accessdate=March 25, 2016|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=March 24, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Starrs|first1=Jenny|title=Tangos and more: Barack Obama's legacy as the dancer in chief|url=http://www.smh.com.au/world/tangos-and-more-barack-obamas-legacy-as-the-dancer-in-chief-20160324-gnqv2q.html|accessdate=March 25, 2016|work=[[Sydney Morning Herald]]|date=March 25, 2016}} The Obamas began their final day in their Latin American trip with President Obama visiting the [[Remembrance park]] in Buenos Aires' [[Belgrano, Buenos Aires|Belgrano]] neighborhood with President Macri to honor the victims of the [[Dirty War]] by throwing flowers onto the [[Río de la Plata]] river. The Obamas' visit to Argentina coincided with the 40th anniversary of the [[1976 Argentine coup d'état]] that extended the "war" and resulted in the killing and the [[forced disappearance]]s of around 30,000 people from 1976 to 1983. The two presidents each delivered remarks at the park, where Obama apologized for the U.S.' "slow" policies in responding to the "war" saying: "Each of us have a responsibility each and every day to make sure that wherever we see injustice, wherever we see rule of law flaunted that we take responsibility to make this a better place for our children and grandchildren." Obama also said that the U.S. would help the families of the victims "heal" from the effects of the "war" through [[Transparency (social)|transparency]] by revealing files that prove the [[Human rights in Argentina|violation of human rights]] during the [[military dictatorship]], upon the request of President Macri.{{cite web|last1=Keane|first1=Angela Greiling|title=Obama Says U.S. to Help Argentina ‘Heal’ From 1970s Dirty War|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/politics/articles/2016-03-23/obama-says-u-s-to-help-argentina-heal-from-1970s-dirty-war|publisher=[[Bloomberg L.P.]]|accessdate=March 25, 2016|date=March 24, 2016}}{{cite news|title=Obama: 'We have the responsibility to confront the past with honesty and transparency'|url=http://www.buenosairesherald.com/article/211333/obama-we-have-the-responsibility-to-confront-the-past-with-honesty-and-transparency|accessdate=March 25, 2016|work=[[Buenos Aires Herald]]|date=March 24, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Mason|first1=Jeff|title=Obama honors Argentina's 'Dirty War' victims; faults U.S. on human rights|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-argentina-idUSKCN0WQ0I9|accessdate=March 25, 2016|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=March 25, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Lahrichi|first1=Kamilia|title=Obama sorry for U.S. policies during Argentina's 'dirty war'|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2016/03/24/obama-speaks-us-role-argentinas-dirty-war/82206754/|accessdate=March 25, 2016|work=[[USA Today]]|date=March 24, 2016}} In the afternoon, the Obama family left Buenos Aires for a trip to the [[Patagonia]]n town of Bariloche; Obama became the fourth U.S. president to visit the town.Manuela Tobias, [http://www.politico.com/magazine/gallery/2016/03/obama-spring-break-bariloche-000625?slide=0 Bariloche, the Spring Break Spot of American Presidents: Obama’s stop in the Argentine town is part of a long tradition], ''Politico Magazine'' (March 24, 2016). The Obamas left Buenos Aires from the [[Ezeiza Airport]] and arrived at Bariloche at the [[San Carlos de Bariloche Airport]].Lynn Sweet, [http://chicago.suntimes.com/columnists/obama-guidance-press-schedule-march-23-2016-more-argentina/ Obama guidance, press schedule March 24, 2016], ''Chicago Sun-Times'' (March 24, 2016). In Bariloche, the family stayed at the [[Llao Llao Hotel]], sailed on the [[Nahuel Huapi Lake]], and hiked in [[Nahuel Huapi National Park]]. President Macri then bade farewell to the Obama family before the Obamas' departure and return to Washington, D.C., ending their five-day Latin American trip.{{cite news|title=The Latest: Argentina's president sees Obama off|url=http://www.bostonherald.com/news/international/2016/03/the_latest_argentinas_president_sees_obama_off|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=March 24, 2016}} |- |{{flagicon|Georgia (U.S. state)}} ''[[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]]'' |[[Atlanta]] |March 29 |President Obama participated in the annual National Rx Drug Abuse & Heroin Summit, held at the [[Westin Peachtree Plaza Hotel]] in [[downtown Atlanta]], where he met with former drug addicts to discuss the combat of [[opioid abuse]].{{cite news|title=Obama pledges $1.1 billion to combat drug addiction|url=http://www.wsbtv.com/news/local/atlanta/pres-obama-to-visit-atlanta-for-drug-abuse-summit/185197242|accessdate=March 31, 2016|work=[[WSB-TV]]|publisher=[[American Broadcasting Company]]|date=March 29, 2016}} |} == April == [[File:Obamas with the Royals (26488482612).jpg|thumb|President Obama greets [[Prince George of Cambridge]], [[Succession to the British throne|third in line to the British throne]], at [[Kensington Palace]] during his visit to [[London]], April 22, 2016]] {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=70|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flagicon|Illinois}} ''[[Illinois]]'' |[[Chicago]] |April 7 |President Obama met with law school students during a town hall discussion at the [[University of Chicago Law School]] to discuss "the [[Supreme Court of the United States|Supreme Court]], the integrity of it as an institution and the importance of it for the country's judicial system," according to [[White House Communications Director]] [[Daniel Pfeiffer]]. Prior to his [[United States Senate election in Illinois, 2004|election in the U.S. Senate]], Obama served as a [[professor]] and a [[senior lecturer]] on [[constitutional law]] at the school. While in Chicago, Obama also pushed for his [[Merrick Garland Supreme Court nomination|nomination]] of [[Merrick Garland]] to replace the late Associate Justice [[Antonin Scalia]] at the Supreme Court.{{cite news|last1=Pearson|first1=Rick|title=Obama to visit Chicago to push for Supreme Court pick|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/local/politics/ct-obama-chicago-visit-0402-20160401-story.html|accessdate=April 3, 2016|work=[[Chicago Tribune]]|date=April 1, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Rhodan|first1=Maya|title=Obama Will Return to Chicago to Make Case for Merrick Garland|url=http://time.com/4278998/president-obama-merrick-garland-supreme-court/|accessdate=April 3, 2016|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|date=April 1, 2016}} |- |{{flagicon|California}} ''[[California]]'' |[[Los Angeles]],
[[Santa Monica, California|Santa Monica]],
[[San Francisco]] |April 7–8 |President Obama and his eldest daughter [[Family of Barack Obama#Malia Obama|Malia]] attended a series of fundraisers within the [[Greater Los Angeles Area]] and the [[San Francisco Bay Area]] for the [[Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee|Democratic Congressional]] (DCCC) and [[Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee|Democratic Senatorial]] (DSCC) campaign committees, including one at the residence of [[Walt Disney Studios (division)|Walt Disney Studios]] chairman [[Alan F. Horn]] in [[Bel Air, Los Angeles|Bel Air]] for the DCCC and another at the residence of actor [[Tobey Maguire]] and his wife [[Jennifer Meyer]] for the DSCC, the following morning.{{cite news|last1=Herbert|first1=Steven|title=Obama in LA for Democratic fundraisers|url=http://www.dailynews.com/government-and-politics/20160407/obama-in-la-for-democratic-fundraisers|accessdate=April 12, 2016|work=[[Los Angeles Daily News]]|date=April 7, 2016}} |- |{{flag|Saudi Arabia}} |[[Riyadh]] |April 20–21 |In Riyadh, President Obama attended a summit meeting with the [[Gulf Cooperation Council]] to discuss ways of addressing [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant|ISIL]] and other regional conflicts, including the [[Syrian Civil War|Syrian]] and [[Yemeni Crisis (2011–present)|Yemeni]] crises.{{cite news|last1=Al-Hamid|first1=Faheem|title=Obama arriving today|url=http://saudigazette.com.sa/saudi-arabia/obama-arriving-today/|accessdate=April 20, 2016|work=[[Saudi Gazette]]|date=April 20, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Lee|first1=Carol|title=President Obama to Visit Saudi Arabia in April|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/president-obama-to-visit-saudi-arabia-in-april-1458136697|accessdate=March 16, 2016|work=[[Wall Street Journal]]|date=March 16, 2016}} He also met with [[Salman of Saudi Arabia|King Salman]] and held an audience with the [[Legal system of Saudi Arabia#The courts and the judiciary|Saudi royal court]].{{cite news|title=Obama heads to Saudi Arabia for fence-mending trip|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/obama-heads-to-saudi-arabia-for-fence-mending-trip/|accessdate=April 15, 2016|work=[[The Times of Israel]]|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|date=April 15, 2016}} Obama's visit to Saudi Arabia coincided with the announcement of a [[Bipartisanship#In U.S. politics|bipartisan bill]] allowing families of victims of the [[September 11 attacks]] to file a lawsuit against Saudi Arabian officials for involvement in the terrorist attacks, which the White House has threatened to veto to avoid tension in [[Saudi Arabia–United States relations]].{{cite news|last1=Gaouette|first1=Nicole|last2=Liptak|first2=Kevin|last3=Kosinski|first3=Michelle|last4=Robertson|first4=Nic|title=White House: Obama 'cleared the air' with Saudi Arabia|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2016/04/20/politics/obama-saudi-arabia-tensions/index.html|accessdate=April 21, 2016|work=[[CNN]]|date=April 21, 2016}} |- |{{flagicon|United Kingdom}} [[United Kingdom]] |[[London]],
[[Windsor, Berkshire|Windsor]],
[[Watford]] |April 21–24 |President Obama stopped by London to urge British voters to vote for the United Kingdom to remain in the European Union ahead of the [[United Kingdom European Union membership referendum, 2016|referendum on June 23]].{{cite news|last1=Ellyatt|first1=Holly|title=Obama to visit UK, warn on 'Brexit': Report|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2016/03/14/obama-to-visit-uk-warn-on-brexit-report.html|accessdate=March 14, 2016|work=[[CNBC]]|date=March 14, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Graham|first1=Chris|title=Barack Obama 'will urge British voters to remain in EU during April visit'|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/eureferendum/12192339/Barack-Obama-will-urge-British-voters-to-remain-in-EU-during-April-visit.html|accessdate=March 14, 2016|work=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|date=March 13, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Siddiqui|first1=Sabrina|title=Obama to offer his friendly opposition to Brexit during visit to UK|url=https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/apr/14/barack-obama-brexit-eu-referendum-uk-visit|accessdate=April 15, 2016|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=April 14, 2016}} On April 22, the President and First Lady Michelle Obama attended a private lunch with [[Queen Elizabeth II]] and [[Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh]] at [[Windsor Castle]], a day after the Queen's 90th birthday.{{cite news|last1=Saenz|first1=Arlette|title=President Obama Has Lunch With Queen Elizabeth at Windsor Castle|url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/president-obama-lunch-queen-elizabeth-windsor-castle/story?id=38566626|accessdate=April 24, 2016|work=[[ABC News]]|date=April 22, 2016}} President Obama also met with [[British Prime Minister]] [[David Cameron]] at [[10 Downing Street]], participating in a joint press conference.{{cite news|last1=Heffer|first1=Greg|title=Obama arrives in Downing Street… leaving 9-tonne ‘The Beast’ to do a 3-point turn|url=http://www.express.co.uk/news/politics/663578/President-Barack-Obama-David-Cameron-Downing-Street-visit-Brexit-EU-referendum|accessdate=April 24, 2016|work=[[Daily Express]]|date=April 22, 2016}} Later that evening, the Obamas attended a dinner hosted by [[Prince William, Duke of Cambridge]], [[Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge]], and [[Prince Harry]] at [[Kensington Palace]].{{cite news|last1=Nelson |first1=Kate |title=Barack Obama London visit: President to dine with Wills and Kate this Friday |url=http://www.london24.com/news/politics/barack_obama_london_visit_president_to_dine_with_wills_and_kate_this_friday_1_4500031 |accessdate=April 19, 2016 |work=London24 |publisher=[[Archant]] |date=April 18, 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160419173928/http://www.london24.com/news/politics/barack_obama_london_visit_president_to_dine_with_wills_and_kate_this_friday_1_4500031 |archivedate=April 19, 2016 |df= }} On April 23, President Obama first toured [[Shakespeare's Globe]] and viewed a snippet from a production of ''[[Hamlet]]'' to commemorate the 400th death anniversary of [[William Shakespeare]].{{cite news|last1=Smith|first1=Chris|title=President Obama visits Shakespeare theatre…|url=http://www.stratford-herald.com/50949-pictures-president-obama-in-stratford.html|accessdate=April 24, 2016|work=Stratford-upon-Avon Herald|date=April 23, 2016}} He then participated in a town hall meeting with the British youth at [[Lindley Hall, London|Lindley Hall]], where he addressed questions regarding political issues like terrorism, trade, and the [[Northern Ireland peace process]],{{cite news|title=President Obama urges next generation of Northern Ireland leaders to forge 'new identity'|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-northern-ireland-36119540|accessdate=April 24, 2016|work=[[BBC News]]|date=April 23, 2016}} as well as social issues and changes involving [[LGBT rights]], [[racial inequality]] (touching on the [[Black Lives Matter]] movement), and [[discrimination towards non-binary gender persons]].{{cite news|last1=Liptak|first1=Kevin|title=Obama questioned on LGBT rights, Black Lives Matter in London|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2016/04/23/politics/obama-london-town-hall/|accessdate=April 24, 2016|work=[[CNN]]|date=April 23, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Jaffe|first1=Greg|title=Obama hears youth leaders’ concerns about LGBT rights, Brexit at British town hall|url=https://www.thestar.com/news/world/2016/04/23/obama-talks-diplomacy-social-change-at-london-youth-town-hall.html|accessdate=April 24, 2016|work=[[The Washington Post]]|date=April 23, 2016}} There at Lindley Hall, Obama also met with [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour Party]] and [[Leader of the Opposition (United Kingdom)|Opposition Leader]] [[Jeremy Corbyn]].{{cite news|last1=Gayle|first1=Damien|title=Jeremy Corbyn and Barack Obama enjoy an 'excellent' discussion|url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2016/apr/23/corporations-and-inequality-on-agenda-as-obama-meets-corbyn|accessdate=April 24, 2016|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=April 23, 2016}} In the afternoon, President Obama and Prime Minister Cameron played golf at [[The Grove, Watford|The Grove]] in [[Watford]], [[Hertfordshire]]. The two leaders then had dinner at [[Winfield House]], the [[United States Ambassador to the United Kingdom|U.S. ambassador]]'s residence in the United Kingdom.{{cite news|last1=Rampton|first1=Roberta|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-britain-eu-obama-golf-idUSKCN0XK0FB|title=Obama, Cameron tee off at exclusive golf course|agency=Reuters|date=April 23, 2016}} President Obama departed for Germany the following day. |- | {{flagicon|Germany}} [[Germany]] | [[Hanover]] | April 24–25 | President Obama traveled to Hanover, Germany to promote the [[Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership]], which was met with criticism among Germans.{{cite news|title=Obama arrives in Germany for final TTIP trade deal push|url=http://www.dw.com/en/obama-arrives-in-germany-for-final-ttip-trade-deal-push/a-19211085|accessdate=April 26, 2016|work=[[Deutsche Welle]]|date=April 24, 2016}} He met with [[German Chancellor]] [[Angela Merkel]] to discuss cooperation in resolving the [[Syrian Civil War|Syrian]] and [[Libyan Civil War (2014–present)|Libyan]] civil wars and the [[Ukrainian crisis]], before discussing the topics with other European leaders including British Prime Minister David Cameron, [[French President]] [[François Hollande]], and [[Italian Prime Minister]] [[Matteo Renzi]].{{cite news|title=Obama urges European allies to step up fight against IS|url=http://www.ejinsight.com/20160426-obama-urges-european-allies-to-step-up-fight-against-is/|accessdate=April 26, 2016|work=[[Hong Kong Economic Journal]]|date=April 26, 2016}} During a news conference with Chancellor Merkel, President Obama announced has planned to increase [[United States Armed Forces|U.S. military]] presence in Syria to at least 250 personnel to [[American-led intervention in Syria|combat]] [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant|ISIL]] and assist local [[Syrian Armed Forces|Syrian forces]] in doing so.{{cite news|last1=Starr|first1=Barbara|last2=Liptak|first2=Kevin|title=Obama announces an additional 250 special operations forces to Syria|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2016/04/24/politics/obama-special-operations-syria/|accessdate=April 26, 2016|work=[[CNN]]|date=April 25, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Shear|first1=Michael D.|title=U.S. to Increase Military Presence in Syria, Obama Says|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/04/26/world/europe/obama-germany-speech.html?_r=0|accessdate=April 26, 2016|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=April 25, 2016}} Obama and Merkel later joined the United States delegation in their participation at the [[Hannover Messe]], the world's largest industrial fair, with the U.S. being the "partner country" of the fair.{{cite news|last1=Fell |first1=Jade |title=US President Barack Obama opens Hannover Messe 2016 |url=http://eandt.theiet.org/news/2016/apr/obama-hannover-messe.cfm |accessdate=April 26, 2016 |work=[[Engineering & Technology]] |publisher=[[Institution of Engineering and Technology]] |date=April 25, 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160426172214/http://eandt.theiet.org/news/2016/apr/obama-hannover-messe.cfm |archivedate=April 26, 2016 |df= }}{{cite web|last1=Vavra|first1=Bob|title=Obama to open Hannover Messe in April|url=http://www.plantengineering.com/single-article/obama-to-open-hannover-messe-in-april/eb044f993b4bf00a2f6b55b898f41101.html|publisher=plantengineering.com|accessdate=December 31, 2015|date=December 30, 2015}} He became the first sitting U.S. president to attend the fair.{{cite news|last1=Korte|first1=Gregory|title=Obama to make fifth trip to Germany in 2016|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2015/12/30/obama-germany-trip-hannover-trade-fair-angela-merkel-2016/78084822/|accessdate=December 31, 2015|work=[[USA Today]]|date=December 30, 2015}} |} == May == [[File:President Barack Obama sips filtered water from Flint following a roundtable on the Flint water crisis at Northwestern High School.jpg|thumb|President Obama sips filtered water in [[Flint, Michigan]] to assure the city's residents of their safety following the [[Flint Michigan water crisis|city's water crisis]], May 4, 2016]] [[File:President Barack Obama and President Tran Dai Quang at the arrival ceremony.jpg|thumb|President Obama and Vietnamese President [[Trần Đại Quang]] during an arrival ceremony at the [[Presidential Palace, Hanoi]], May 23, 2016]] {|
