''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=70|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- | {{flagicon|Michigan}} ''[[Michigan]]'' | [[Flint, Michigan|Flint]] | May 4 | President Obama traveled to Flint, Michigan, in response to the [[Flint Michigan water crisis|water crisis in that city]], calling on the [[Government of Michigan|Michigan government]] to provide safe [[drinking water]]. President Obama responded to an email from 8-year-old Flint resident Amariyanna "Mari" Copeny, in which she pleaded with him to visit Flint. President Obama responded, stating that he accepted her invitation to visit Flint. The president also met with Flint Mayor [[Karen Weaver]] and Michigan Governor [[Rick Snyder]], among others.{{cite news|last1=Scott|first1=Eugene|title=Obama to visit Flint to survey water crisis|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2016/04/27/politics/obama-flint-michigan-water-crisis/|accessdate=April 28, 2016|publisher=CNN|date=April 27, 2016}}{{cite news|last=Wagner|first=Laura|title=Obama Responds To 8-Year-Old's Email, Says He'll Visit Flint, Mich.|url=https://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2016/04/27/475952269/obama-responds-to-8-year-olds-email-says-hell-visit-flint-mich|accessdate=April 27, 2016|work=[[National Public Radio]]|date=April 27, 2016}} Obama visited the Food Bank of Eastern Michigan, where he sipped the city's filtered water to assure Flint residents of their safety, and addressed the people of Flint at the [[Flint Northwestern High School]].{{cite news|last1=Freking|first1=Kevin|title=Obama tells Flint residents: 'I've got your back'|url=http://www.startribune.com/obama-visiting-flint-for-first-time-since-water-crisis-began/378068711/|accessdate=May 5, 2016|work=Star Tribune|agency=Associated Press|date=May 4, 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160505032751/http://www.startribune.com/obama-visiting-flint-for-first-time-since-water-crisis-began/378068711/|archivedate=May 5, 2016|df=}} |- | {{flagicon|New Jersey}} ''[[New Jersey]]'' | [[New Brunswick, New Jersey|New Brunswick]] | May 15 | President Obama delivered a [[commencement speech]] at [[Rutgers University]]'s 250th anniversary commencement ceremony, held at the university's [[High Point Solutions Stadium]].{{cite news|last1=Siemaszko|first1=Corky|title=Obama to give commencement speeches at Howard, Rutgers, USAF|url=http://www.msnbc.com/msnbc/obama-give-commencement-speeches-howard-rutgers-usaf|accessdate=April 15, 2016|work=MSNBC|date=April 14, 2016}}{{cite web|title=President Barack Obama to Deliver Commencement Address at Rutgers University-New Brunswick|url=http://news.rutgers.edu/news-release/president-barack-obama-deliver-commencement-address-rutgers-university-new-brunswick/20160414|publisher=[[Rutgers University]]|accessdate=April 15, 2016|date=April 14, 2016}} |- |{{flagicon|Vietnam}} [[Vietnam]] |[[Hanoi]],
[[Ho Chi Minh City]] |May 22–25 |During the U.S.-ASEAN Summit in February 2016, a White House official confirmed that President Obama had accepted an invitation from [[Prime Minister of Vietnam|Vietnamese Prime Minister]] [[Nguyễn Tấn Dũng]] to visit Vietnam in May, as part of a trip to Asia.{{cite news|title=Obama to visit Vietnam in May: White House|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-asean-vietnam-idUSKCN0VP09D|accessdate=February 17, 2016|agency=Reuters|date=February 15, 2016}} The trip aims to build stronger economic and defense ties with Asian-Pacific allies, amid the [[Territorial disputes in the South China Sea|South China Sea territorial disputes]].{{cite news|title=Obama looks to boost economic ties with trip to Vietnam|url=https://www.pbs.org/newshour/rundown/lawmakers-urge-obama-to-address-human-rights-on-vietnam-trip/|accessdate=May 23, 2016|work=[[PBS NewsHour]]|date=May 21, 2016}} The Obama administration has expressed its commitment to assist Vietnam in seeking [[maritime security]] and the [[freedom of navigation]] in the [[South China Sea]].{{cite news|last1=Nakamura|first1=David|title=Obama to make first visit to Vietnam in May|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-politics/wp/2016/02/15/obama-to-make-first-visit-to-vietnam-in-may/|accessdate=February 17, 2016|work=[[The Washington Post]]|date=February 15, 2016}} President Obama arrived in Hanoi on late Sunday, May 22.{{cite news|last1=Son|first1=Truong|title=US President Obama arrives in Hanoi to strengthen economic, security ties|url=http://www.thanhniennews.com/politics/us-president-obama-arrives-in-hanoi-to-strengthen-economic-security-ties-62451.html|accessdate=May 23, 2016|work=[[Thanh Niên]]|date=May 23, 2016}} The following day, he met with [[President of Vietnam|Vietnamese President]] [[Trần Đại Quang]] at the [[Presidential Palace, Hanoi|Presidential Palace of Vietnam]] and [[Chairman of the National Assembly of Vietnam|National Assembly Chairwoman]] [[Nguyễn Thị Kim Ngân]] at the former residence of revolutionary [[Communism in Vietnam|Communist]] leader [[Ho Chi Minh]]. President Obama and President Quang discussed the continuing normalization of ties between the two countries following the [[Vietnam War]], the pursuit of the [[Trans-Pacific Partnership]] to support trade and reinforce regional cooperation, and defense cooperation in the South China Sea territorial disputes. The two presidents also signed several bilateral agreements, including a $11.3 billion purchase of 100 [[Boeing]] aircraft by the Vietnamese [[low-cost carrier]] [[VietJet Air]]. During a joint press conference with President Quang, Obama announced the full lifting of a 50-year [[arms embargo]] on Vietnam, describing the embargo as "a lingering vestige of the [[Cold War]]."{{cite news|title=Obama lifts US embargo on lethal arms sales to Vietnam|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-36356695|accessdate=May 23, 2016|publisher=[[BBC News]]|date=May 23, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Jackson|first1=David|last2=Maresca|first2=Thomas|title=Obama ends U.S. arms embargo on Vietnam during visit to former enemy|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2016/05/23/obama-lifts-arms-export-embargo-vietnam/84766206/|accessdate=May 24, 2016|work=[[USA Today]]|date=May 23, 2016}} He also announced that the [[Peace Corps]] would operate in Vietnam for the first time, focused on teaching the [[English language]] to Vietnamese students.{{cite news|last1=Saenz|first1=Arlette|title=President Obama Announces the Peace Corps Going to Vietnam for First Time|url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/president-obama-announces-peace-corps-coming-vietnam-time/story?id=39299626|accessdate=May 24, 2016|publisher=[[ABC News]]|date=May 23, 2016}}{{cite web|title=Remarks by President Obama and President Quang of Vietnam in Joint Press Conference|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2016/05/23/remarks-president-obama-and-president-quang-vietnam-joint-press|publisher=[[White House Office of the Press Secretary]]|accessdate=May 24, 2016|date=May 23, 2016}} In the afternoon, President Obama attended a state luncheon at the [[Presidential Palace, Hanoi]], hosted by President Quang, with [[Prime Minister of Vietnam|Prime Minister]] [[Nguyễn Xuân Phúc]], [[Communist Party of Vietnam|Communist Party]] [[General Secretary of the Communist Party of Vietnam|General Secretary]] [[Nguyễn Phú Trọng]], and [[National Assembly of Vietnam|National Assembly]] chairwoman [[Nguyễn Thị Kim Ngân]] in attendance.{{cite news|title=Toast Remarks by President Obama and President Quang of Vietnam at State Luncheon|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2016/05/23/toast-remarks-president-obama-and-president-quang-vietnam-state-luncheon|accessdate=May 24, 2016|location=Presidential Palace, Hanoi, Vietnam|publisher=[[White House Office of the Press Secretary]]|date=May 23, 2016}} In the evening, President Obama dined with American celebrity chef [[Anthony Bourdain]] at a local Hanoi restaurant, filming for an episode of Bourdain's show, ''[[Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown]]''.{{cite news|last1=Krieg|first1=Gregory|title=Barack Obama, Anthony Bourdain dine in Vietnam|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2016/05/23/politics/barack-obama-anthony-bourdain-vietnam/index.html|accessdate=May 24, 2016|publisher=CNN|date=May 24, 2016}} On Tuesday, May 24, President Obama first met with ten activists advocating to solve different social issues facing Vietnam, including [[human rights in Vietnam|human rights]] issues such as [[freedom of speech]], [[freedom of the press]] and [[Internet censorship in Vietnam|Internet freedom]].{{cite news|title=Obama reaches out to people a day after Vietnam arms deal|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/787260/obama-reaches-out-to-people-a-day-after-vietnam-arms-deal|accessdate=May 24, 2016|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|agency=Associated Press|date=May 24, 2016}} He later addressed the Vietnamese people from the [[Vietnam National Convention Center]] to discuss the progress made by [[United States–Vietnam relations|the United States and Vietnam]] following the Vietnam War while taking into account their differences in [[human rights]], which Obama prompts Vietnam for, saying that "the country should be more open to scrutiny in order to grow stronger and more prosperous" since "human rights is not a threat to stability but reinforces it."{{cite news|title=President Obama's speech on Vietnam-US relations in Hanoi|url=http://english.vietnamnet.vn/fms/government/156935/president-obama-s-speech-on-vietnam-us-relations-in-hanoi.html|accessdate=May 24, 2016|work=VietNamNet|date=May 24, 2016}}{{cite news|title=Obama prods Vietnam on rights after activists stopped from meeting him |url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asiapacific/arms-embargo-on-vietnam/2808472.html |accessdate=May 24, 2016 |work=[[Channel NewsAsia]] |agency=[[Reuters]] |publisher=[[Mediacorp]] |date=May 23, 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160524132733/http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asiapacific/arms-embargo-on-vietnam/2808472.html |archivedate=May 24, 2016 |df= }}{{cite news|last1=Griffiths|first1=James|last2=Boykoff|first2=Pamela|last3=Wright|first3=Rebecca|title=Obama raises human rights in Vietnam, calls for 'peaceful resolution' of South China Sea disputes|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2016/05/24/politics/obama-vietnam-south-china-sea/index.html|accessdate=May 24, 2016|publisher=CNN|date=May 24, 2016}} Following his speech, Obama departed Hanoi for Ho Chi Minh City, the country's largest city, arriving there late afternoon. In Ho Chi Minh City, President Obama visited the [[Jade Emperor Pagoda]] to pay tribute to the [[culture of Vietnam]], which is one of the oldest in [[Southeast Asia]].{{cite news|last1=Lap|first1=Doc|last2=Hieu|first2=Trung|title=Obama touches down in Ho Chi Minh City, visits century-old pagoda|url=http://www.thanhniennews.com/politics/obama-touches-down-in-ho-chi-minh-city-visits-centuryold-pagoda-62520.html|accessdate=May 24, 2016|work=[[Thanh Niên]]|date=May 24, 2016}}{{cite news|title=President Obama visits century-old pagoda upon arriving in Ho Chi Minh City|url=http://tuoitrenews.vn/society/34983/president-obama-visits-centuryold-pagoda-upon-arriving-in-ho-chi-minh-city|accessdate=May 24, 2016|work=[[Tuổi Trẻ]]|date=May 24, 2016}} He later met with young entrepreneurs and the local business community at the DreamPlex Coworking Space, where he also promoted the proposed Trans-Pacific Partnership, saying that it will boost economic [[competitiveness]] and improve labor standards that would prohibit [[Unfree labor|forced]] and [[Child labour|child labor]].{{cite news|title=Barack Obama urges improved human rights in Vietnam in wake of US arms deal|url=http://home.bt.com/news/world-news/barack-obama-urges-improved-human-rights-in-vietnam-in-wake-of-us-arms-deal-11364064058335|accessdate=May 24, 2016|work=bt.com|publisher=[[BT Group]]|date=May 24, 2016}} On Wednesday, May 25, President Obama met with [[Japanese Prime Minister]] [[Shinzō Abe]] ahead of the [[42nd G7 summit]], a conference of the leaders of the [[G7|Group of Seven]] nations.{{cite news|title=Obama, Abe heed politics of contrition on Hiroshima visit|url=http://bigstory.ap.org/article/218164c3bcf84984b75e47fe948bb90d/obama-wrap-trip-vietnam-talking-young-leaders|accessdate=May 25, 2016|agency=Associated Press|date=May 25, 2016}} On the same day, Obama participated in the Young Southeast Asian Leaders Initiative (YSAELI) town hall, where he urged some 800 young Southeast Asian leaders to tackle [[climate change]].{{cite news|last1=Saine|first1=Cindy|title=Obama Praises Vietnamese Youth in Personal Exchange|url=http://www.voanews.com/content/obama-praises-vietnamese-youth-in-personal-exchange/3345046.html|accessdate=May 25, 2016|publisher=[[Voice of America]]|date=May 25, 2016}} Obama ended his three-day visit to Vietnam, departing Ho Chi Minh City for Japan later that afternoon. |- |{{flagicon|Japan}} [[Japan]] |[[Shima, Mie|Shima]],
[[Ise, Mie|Ise]],
[[Hiroshima]] |May 25–27 |President Obama traveled to Japan to attend the [[42nd G7 summit]] in Shima, [[Mie Prefecture]], where the agenda focused on the [[global economy]], geopolitical issues like [[North Korea and weapons of mass destruction|North Korea's nuclear program]], the [[Territorial disputes in the South China Sea|South China Sea territorial disputes]] and the [[Ukrainian crisis]], and the threats of [[Islamic extremism]] in the Middle East.{{cite news|last1=Hammond|first1=Andrew|title=G7 summit and Korea|url=http://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/opinon/2016/05/197_205522.html|accessdate=May 26, 2016|work=[[The Korea Times]]|date=May 25, 2016}} Prior to the G7 summit, Obama held bilateral talks with Japanese Prime Minister Abe on similar issues. During a joint news conference, Abe protested a recent killing of a 20-year-old [[Okinawa]] woman by a former [[United States Marine Corps|U.S. Marine]] from [[Kadena Air Base]]. Obama expressed regret for the murder and said that the U.S. is willing to fully cooperate with the investigation.{{cite news|last1=Mie|first1=Ayako|last2=Yoshida|first2=Reiji|title=Anger over Okinawa murder grows despite Obama’s ‘deep regret’ over the incident|url=http://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2016/05/26/national/politics-diplomacy/okinawa-murder-clouds-abe-obama-summit-talks/|accessdate=May 26, 2016|work=[[The Japan Times]]|date=May 26, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Ryall|first1=Julian|title=Barack Obama rebuked by Japanese leader over alleged killing by US national|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/05/26/barack-obama-rebuked-by-japanese-leader-over-alleged-killing-by/|accessdate=May 26, 2016|work=[[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]]|date=May 26, 2016}} The G7 leaders also visited the [[Ise Grand Shrine]], a [[Shinto shrine]] in the city of [[Ise, Mie|Ise]].{{cite news|title=Ise Shrine visit marks start of G-7|url=http://asia.nikkei.com/Politics-Economy/International-Relations/Ise-Shrine-visit-marks-start-of-G-7|accessdate=May 26, 2016|work=[[The Nikkei]]|date=May 26, 2016}} On Friday, May 27, Obama traveled to Hiroshima to visit the [[Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park]] with Prime Minister Abe to highlight their continued commitment to pursuing [[world peace|peace]] and security in a world without nuclear weapons.{{cite news|title=Barack Obama to visit Hiroshima on Asia trip|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-36258866|accessdate=May 10, 2016|publisher=BBC News|date=May 10, 2016}} In doing so, Obama became the first sitting American president to visit the site of the U.S. [[Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki|atomic bombing of Hiroshima]] in August 1945.{{cite web| last=Liptak| first=Kevin| url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/05/10/politics/obama-hiroshima-visit-japan/index.html| title=Obama to make historic visit to Hiroshima|date=May 10, 2016|publisher=CNN}} |- |{{flagicon|Virginia}} ''[[Virginia]]'' |[[Arlington, Virginia|Arlington]] |May 30 |President Obama participated in [[Memorial Day]] ceremonies at [[Arlington National Cemetery]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/05/30/politics/obama-memorial-day-arlington-cemetery/index.html|title=Obama marks last Memorial Day in office|last=CNN|first=Laura Koran|website=CNN|access-date=2017-06-03}} |} == June == [[File:President Obama Delivers a Statement in Orlando.webm|thumb|President Obama delivers a statement in [[Orlando, Florida]] after meeting with the families and victims of the [[2016 Orlando nightclub shooting|nightclub shooting]], June 16, 2016]] {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=70|Date(s) ! width=550|Notes |- | {{flagicon|Indiana}} ''[[Indiana]]'' | [[Elkhart, Indiana|Elkhart]] | June 1 | President Obama visited Elkhart, Indiana to highlight the economic progress made by his administration during his presidency, where he delivered remarks and held a town hall meeting at [[Concord High School (Elkhart, Indiana)|Concord High School]]. Elkhart was the first city Obama visited as president in February 2009 when the city was among those that were severely affected by the [[Great Recession in the United States|Great Recession]], prompting the [[American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009]].{{cite news|last1=Groppe|first1=Maureen|title=Obama returning to Elkhart, Ind., for town hall meeting next week|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2016/05/24/obama-returning-elkhart-ind-town-hall-meeting-next-week/84878292/|accessdate=May 27, 2016|work=[[USA Today]]|date=May 24, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Shella|first1=Jim|title=President Obama will visit Elkhart for a third time|url=http://wishtv.com/2016/05/26/president-obama-will-visit-elkhart-for-a-third-time/|accessdate=May 27, 2016|publisher=[[WISH-TV]], [[Media General]]|date=May 26, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|Colorado}} ''[[Colorado]]'' | [[Colorado Springs, Colorado|Colorado Springs]] | June 2 | President Obama delivered the commencement speech at the [[United States Air Force Academy]]. While in Colorado Springs, an [[F-16]] fighter jet crashed at nearby [[Peterson Air Force Base]]. The pilot, a member of the [[United States Air Force Thunderbirds|Thunderbirds]] Air Force demonstration squadron, ejected safely and later met with President Obama. The president thanked the pilot for his service to the country, and also thanked the emergency responders for their efforts.{{cite news|last=Crawford|first=Jamie|title=Blue Angels jet, Thunderbird F-16 crash in separate incidents|url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/06/02/politics/military-plane-crash/index.html?adkey=bn|accessdate=June 2, 2016|publisher=CNN|date=June 2, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|Florida}} ''[[Florida]]'' | [[Miami]],
[[Miami Beach, Florida|Miami Beach]],
[[Palm City, Florida|Palm City]] | June 3–5 | President Obama attended a series of fundraisers for the Democratic Party, including one for Florida Representative [[Patrick Murphy (Florida politician)|Patrick Murphy]]'s [[United States Senate election in Florida, 2016|Senate election bid]], across the [[Miami metropolitan area]]. The President spent the remainder of his weekend in Palm City.{{cite news|last1=Ortega|first1=Oralia|title=President Obama Wraps Up Miami Stop|url=http://miami.cbslocal.com/2016/06/03/president-obama-coming-to-miami-2/|accessdate=June 13, 2016|publisher=[[WFOR-TV]], [[CBS Corporation|CBS Television Stations, Inc.]]|date=June 3, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|New York}} ''[[New York (state)|New York]]'' | [[New York City]] | June 8 | President Obama taped an appearance on ''[[The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon]]'' and attended a [[Democratic National Committee]] fundraiser at the residence of ''[[The Huffington Post]]'' co-founder and [[BuzzFeed]] chairman [[Kenneth Lerer]] in [[Manhattan]].{{cite news|last1=Rhodan|first1=Maya|title=President Obama: 'I Am Worried About the Republican Party'|url=http://time.com/4362236/barack-obama-worried-about-republican-party-donald-trump-jimmy-fallon-tonight-show/|accessdate=June 9, 2016|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|date=June 8, 2016}}{{cite news|author1=[[Brian Stelter|Stelter, Brian]]|title=Buzzfeed chairman hosting Obama at Democratic fundraiser|url=http://money.cnn.com/2016/06/07/media/buzzfeed-kenneth-lerer-democratic-fundraiser/|accessdate=June 9, 2016|work=[[CNNMoney]]|publisher=[[Time Warner]]|date=June 7, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|Florida}} ''Florida'' | [[Orlando, Florida|Orlando]] | June 16 | President Obama traveled to Orlando, Florida in the wake of the [[2016 Orlando nightclub shooting|deadly nightclub shooting there]], the deadliest [[mass shooting]] in U.S. history. The president paid his respects to the victims' families.{{cite news|title=President Obama to visit Orlando Thursday|url=http://wfla.com/2016/06/13/president-obama-to-visit-orlando-thursday/|accessdate=June 13, 2016|publisher=[[WFLA-TV]]|date=June 13, 2016}} President Obama was accompanied by Vice President [[Joe Biden]] on the trip. Obama traveled to Florida aboard [[Air Force One]] along with U.S. Senator [[Bill Nelson (politician)|Bill Nelson]], U.S. Senator [[Marco Rubio]], and Florida Representative [[Corrine Brown]]. President Obama spent several hours at the [[Amway Center]], meeting with and giving his condolences to the families and friends of the [[Pulse (nightclub)|Pulse]] LGBT nightclub shooting victims.{{cite news|first=Steven|last=Lemongello|title=President Obama and Vice President Biden to visit Orlando on Thursday|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/pulse-orlando-nightclub-shooting/os-president-obama-and-vice-president-biden-to-visit-orlando-thursday-20160615-story.html|accessdate=June 15, 2016|work=[[Orlando Sentinel]]|date=June 15, 2016}}{{cite news|title=Obama meets with Orlando shooting survivors, family of victims|url=http://kxan.com/2016/06/16/obama-meets-with-orlando-shooting-survivors-family-of-victims/ |accessdate=June 16, 2016|agency=Associated Press|date=June 16, 2016}} Obama and Biden then traveled to the [[Dr. Phillips Center for the Performing Arts]], where they placed 49 white roses at a memorial for the shooting victims - one rose for each murder victim.{{cite news|last1=Lemongello|first1=Steven|last2=Weiner|first2=Jeff|title=Obama in Orlando: 'Our hearts are broken too'|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/pulse-orlando-nightclub-shooting/os-obama-in-orlando-to-meet-victims-of-massacre-20160616-story.html |accessdate=June 16, 2016|work=Orlando Sentinel|date=June 16, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|New Mexico}} ''[[New Mexico]]'' | [[Carlsbad Caverns National Park]] | June 17 | President Obama and the First Family visited Carlsbad Caverns National Park as part of the [[National Park Service]]'s centennial celebrations to promote [[nature conservation]].{{cite news|last1=Backus|first1=Alex|title=President Obama, family to visit Yosemite|url=http://www.yourcentralvalley.com/news/president-obama-family-to-visit-yosemite|accessdate=June 13, 2016|publisher=[[KGPE]], [[Nexstar Media Group|Nexstar Media Group, Inc.]]|date=June 9, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Hayden|first1=Maddy|title=President Obama to visit Carlsbad Caverns|url=http://www.lcsun-news.com/story/news/2016/06/09/president-obama-visit-carlsbad-caverns/85676988/|accessdate=June 13, 2016|work=[[Carlsbad Current-Argus]]|via=''[[Las Cruces Sun-News]]''|date=June 9, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|California}} ''[[California]]'' | [[Yosemite National Park]] | June 17–19 | President Obama and the First Family visited Yosemite National Park as part of the National Park Service's centennial celebrations to promote nature conservation.{{cite news|last1=Doyle|first1=Michael|title=Obama to visit Yosemite National Park next week|url=http://www.mcclatchydc.com/news/politics-government/white-house/article82863187.html|accessdate=June 13, 2016|work=McClatchyDC.com|publisher=[[The McClatchy Company]]|date=June 9, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|California}} ''California'' | [[San Francisco Bay Area]] | June 23–24 | President Obama attended the Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2016 at [[Stanford University]], where he held a conversation with technology leaders like [[Facebook]] CEO and co-founder [[Mark Zuckerberg]].{{cite news|last1=Batey|first1=Eve|title=President Obama's Visit With Mark Zuckerberg Will Snarl SoMa Traffic Tonight|url=http://sfist.com/2016/06/23/president_obamas_visit_with_mark_zu.php|accessdate=June 25, 2016|work=SFist|publisher=[[Gothamist]]|date=June 23, 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160626071137/http://sfist.com/2016/06/23/president_obamas_visit_with_mark_zu.php|archivedate=June 26, 2016|df=}}{{cite news|last1=Mattson|first1=Sophie|last2=Knowles|first2=Hannah|last3=Newman|first3=Bruce|title=Obama arrives in Bay Area for two-day visit|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/bay-area-news/ci_30051054/obama-arrives-bay-area-two-day-visit|accessdate=June 25, 2016|work=[[San Jose Mercury News]]|date=June 24, 2016}} During his speech at the convention, Obama commented on the [[United Kingdom withdrawal from the European Union|United Kingdom's decision to withdraw]] from the [[European Union]] following the result of their [[United Kingdom European Union membership referendum, 2016|nationwide referendum]] held on June 23, saying that the [[Special Relationship]] between the U.S. and the UK is "enduring"; that UK's [[Member states of NATO|membership in NATO]] is "a vital cornerstone of [[Foreign policy of the United States|U.S. foreign]], security, and economic policy"; and the U.S.' relationship with both the UK and the EU will "remain indispensable".{{cite news|last1=Berenson|first1=Tessa|title=Obama: Brexit Won’t Affect ‘Special Relationship’ Between U.K. and U.S.|url=http://time.com/4381487/brexit-barack-obama-joe-biden/|accessdate=June 25, 2016|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|date=June 25, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Garcia|first1=Feliks|title=Barack Obama weighs in on Brexit vote amid global panic: 'UK and US will remain indispensable partners'|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/brexit-latest-news-barack-obama-eu-referendum-uk-us-indispensable-partners-a7101166.html|accessdate=June 25, 2016|work=[[The Independent]]|date=June 25, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|Washington}} ''[[Washington (state)|Washington]]'' | [[Seattle]],
[[Medina, Washington|Medina]] | June 24–25 | President Obama attended two fundraisers in or near the [[Seattle metropolitan area]], one for [[Governor of Washington|Washington Governor]] [[Jay Inslee]]'s [[Washington gubernatorial election, 2016|re-election]] campaign at the [[Washington State Convention Center]] in Seattle and another at the residence of [[Concur Technologies]] CEO Steve Singh in Medina.{{cite news|title=What to know about President Obama's Seattle visit|url=http://www.kiro7.com/news/local/president-obama-to-visit-seattle-on-friday/360492190|accessdate=June 25, 2016|work=[[KIRO-TV]]|publisher=[[Cox Media Group]]|date=June 24, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|Canada}} [[Canada]] | [[Ottawa]] | June 29 | President Obama traveled to Canada for a state visit, where he met with [[Governor General of Canada|Canadian Governor General]] [[David Johnston]] and [[Prime Minister of Canada|Canadian Prime Minister]] [[Justin Trudeau]] and addressed a joint session of the [[Parliament of Canada|Canadian Parliament]]. He also participated in the [[North American Leaders' Summit]] with Prime Minister Trudeau and [[President of Mexico|Mexican President]] [[Enrique Peña Nieto]].{{cite news|last=Rampton|first=Roberta|title='Three Amigos' Obama, Trudeau, Pena Nieto to meet June 29|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-canada-obama-idUSKCN0XV284|accessdate=June 2, 2016|agency=Reuters|date=May 4, 2016}} |} == July == [[File:President Barack Obama is greeted by U.S. and Spanish service members along with their families during his visit to Naval Station Rota (28191347486).jpg|thumb|President Obama is greeted by U.S. and Spanish troops during a visit to [[Naval Station Rota, Spain]], July 10, 2016]] {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=70|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- | {{flagicon|North Carolina}} ''[[North Carolina]]'' | [[Charlotte, North Carolina|Charlotte]] | July 5 | President Obama campaigned with former [[United States Secretary of State|Secretary of State]] [[Hillary Clinton]] at the [[Charlotte Convention Center]] in Charlotte, North Carolina for the latter's [[Hillary Clinton presidential campaign, 2016|bid]] for the presidency in the [[United States presidential election, 2016|2016 election]].{{cite news|authors=Amy Chozick & Michael D. Shear|title=Obama Joins Hillary Clinton on Stump, Saying She 'Has Been Tested'|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/07/06/us/politics/hillary-clinton-obama.html|newspaper=New York Times|date=July 5, 2016}}{{cite news|publisher=[[WSOC-TV]] |date=July 6, 2016 |first1=Jim |last1=Bradley |first2=Joe |last2=Bruno |first3=Blake |last3=Hanson |first4=Liz |last4=Foster |first5=Alexa |last5=Ashwell |title=Clinton, Obama rally in Charlotte; Trump takes stage in Raleigh |url=http://www.wsoctv.com/news/local/what-to-know-a-guide-to-clinton-obamas-visit-to-charlotte/384254445 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160706155632/http://www.wsoctv.com/news/local/what-to-know-a-guide-to-clinton-obamas-visit-to-charlotte/384254445 |archive-date=July 6, 2016 |deadurl=yes |df= }} |- | {{flagicon|Poland}} [[Poland]] | [[Warsaw]] | July 7–9 | President Obama traveled to Poland to attend the [[2016 Warsaw summit|NATO summit meeting]] in Warsaw and met with [[Polish President]] [[Andrzej Duda]], [[European Council]] [[President of the European Council|President]] and former [[Polish Prime Minister]] [[Donald Tusk]], and [[European Commission]] [[President of the European Commission|President]] [[Jean-Claude Juncker]] to discuss [[counterterrorism]], the [[Refugees of the Syrian Civil War|Syrian refugee crisis]], and economics.{{cite news|title=Obama to Pay 1st Visit to Spain During July Trip to Poland|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/wireStory/obama-pay-1st-visit-spain-july-trip-poland-39638579|accessdate=June 9, 2016|agency=[[Associated Press]]|via=[[ABC News]]|date=June 6, 2016}} The agenda of Obama's last NATO summit focused on strengthening defense cooperation to protect [[Eastern Europe]] from [[Russian military intervention in Ukraine (2014–present)|Russian aggression on Ukraine]], confronting the [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant|ISIL]] in Iraq and Syria, the [[European migrant crisis]], and the [[United Kingdom withdrawal from the European Union]].{{cite news|title=NATO Vows To Bolster Defenses Bordering Russia|url=http://www.rferl.org/content/nato-summit-obama-oped-concrete-commitments/27845816.html|accessdate=July 9, 2016|publisher=[[Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty]]|date=July 8, 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Shuster|first1=Simon|title=Brexit and Russia Make President Obama’s Last NATO Summit His Toughest Ever|url=http://time.com/4395956/nato-summit-warsaw-barack-obama-russia-brexit/|accessdate=July 9, 2016|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|date=July 6, 2016}} He also announced that around 1,000 extra troops will be deployed to Poland to bolster Nato's eastern flank.{{cite news|last1=Borger|first1=Julian|title=Nato summit: US says it will deploy 1,000 extra troops to Poland|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/jul/08/nato-summit-warsaw-brexit-russia|accessdate=July 9, 2016|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=July 8, 2016}} While in Warsaw, President Obama also addressed American public reaction to the [[shooting of Alton Sterling]] in [[Baton Rouge, Louisiana]] and the [[shooting of Philando Castile]] in [[Minnesota]], cases which have led to protests in the United States and allegations of racial injustice and profiling by police. Obama stated, in part, “When incidents like these occur, there’s a big chunk of our fellow citizens that feels as if because of the color of their skin, they are not being treated the same—and that hurts." The police shootings in Louisiana and Minnesota have led to large, nationwide protests in the United States.{{cite news|last=Kelly|first=Nora|title=President Obama: ‘This Is an American Issue That We Should All Care About’|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2016/07/obama-shootings-minnesota-louisiana/490403/|accessdate=July 7, 2016|agency=[[The Atlantic (magazine)|The Atlantic]]|date=July 7, 2016}} During a joint press conference with Presidents Tusk and Juncker, Obama also commented on the [[2016 shooting of Dallas police officers|shooting of Dallas police officers]] in the aftermath of the fatal shootings of Sterling and Castile, the deadliest single incident in the history of [[Law enforcement in the United States|U.S. law enforcement]] since the [[September 11, 2001 attacks]], which he called "a vicious, calculated and despicable attack on law enforcement."{{cite news|last1=Liptak|first1=Kevin|title=Obama on Dallas: 'Vicious, calculated, despicable attack on law enforcement'|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2016/07/08/politics/obama-dallas-police-shootings/index.html?sr=fbCNN070816obama-dallas-police-shootings0951AMVODtopLink&linkId=26333832|accessdate=July 8, 2016|work=[[CNN]]|date=July 8, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|Spain}} [[Spain]] | [[Madrid]],
[[Rota, Cádiz|Rota]] | July 9–10 | President Obama traveled to Spain for the first time as president to meet with the [[Spanish Prime Minister]] [[Mariano Rajoy]] and King [[Felipe VI of Spain|Felipe VI]]. He also meet with troops at [[Naval Station Rota, Spain|Naval Station Rota]] in Rota, Cádiz. The President initially scheduled a trip to [[Seville]] on July 11 to visit the remains of [[Christopher Columbus]], but decided to cancel it and return to Washington, D.C. earlier in preparation for his visit to [[Dallas, Texas]] later that week.{{cite news|last1=Sink|first1=Justin|title=Obama Plans Trip to Dallas After Cutting Short Travel in Spain|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/politics/articles/2016-07-08/obama-plans-trip-to-dallas-after-cutting-short-travel-in-spain|accessdate=July 9, 2016|work=[[Bloomberg Politics]]|date=July 9, 2016}}{{cite news|title=Barack Obama to cut short Europe trip, to visit Dallas next week|url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/international/world-news/barack-obama-to-cut-short-europe-trip-to-visit-dallas-next-week/articleshow/53125113.cms|accessdate=July 9, 2016|agency=[[Press Trust of India]]|via=''[[The Economic Times]]''|date=July 9, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|Texas}} ''[[Texas]]'' | [[Dallas]] | July 12 | President Obama accepted the invitation of Dallas Mayor [[Mike Rawlings]] to travel to Dallas, Texas to speak at the memorial service at the [[Morton H. Meyerson Symphony Center]] for the [[2016 shooting of Dallas police officers|five police officers killed in the city on July 7]]. President Obama and former President [[George W. Bush]] both delivered speeches.Gardiner Harris & Mark Landler, [https://www.nytimes.com/2016/07/13/us/politics/obama-dallas-attacks-speech.html Obama Tells Mourning Dallas, 'We Are Not as Divided as We Seem'], ''New York Times'' (July 11, 2016). Also in attendance were First Lady [[Michelle Obama]], Vice President [[Joe Biden]] and Second Lady [[Jill Biden]], and former First Lady [[Laura Bush]].{{cite news|last1=Collinson|first1=Stephen|title=Obama balances respect and frustration with police, protesters|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2016/07/12/politics/dallas-shooting-obama-george-w-bush/|accessdate=July 15, 2016|work=[[CNN]]|date=July 13, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|Pennsylvania}} ''[[Pennsylvania]]'' | [[Philadelphia]] | July 27 | President Obama spoke at the [[2016 Democratic National Convention]].{{cite news|last1=McCain Nelson|first1=Colleen|title=Wednesday Preview: Barack Obama, Joe Biden Set to Vouch for Hillary Clinton in Philadelphia|url=https://blogs.wsj.com/washwire/2016/07/27/wednesday-preview-barack-obama-joe-biden-set-to-vouch-for-hillary-clinton-in-philadelphia/|accessdate=July 27, 2016|work=[[The Wall Street Journal]]|date=July 27, 2016}} |} == August == {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country/

President Obama spoke before a crowd at [[Harveys Lake Tahoe]], in Stateline.{{cite news|last=Spillman|first=Benjamin|title=Obama burnishes environmental legacy at Lake ''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=100|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- | ''[[Midway Atoll]]'' | Sand Island | September 1 | President Obama traveled to Sand Island in the Midway Atoll, an [[Unincorporated territories of the United States|unincorporated territory]] of the United States, arriving at [[Henderson Field (Midway Atoll)|Henderson Field]]. The purpose of the visit was to commemorate the expansion of the [[Papahānaumokuākea Marine National Monument]] [[National Wildlife Refuge]] in the area, accomplished by the President's [[Executive order (United States)|Executive Order]]. The President called for increased world action on environmental protection while speaking at Turtle Beach.{{cite web|author=Josh the day to [[Midway Atoll]]. Obama spent the night on [[Oahu]], then traveled to China the next day.{{cite web |url=http://khon2.com/2016/09/01/president-obama-lands-in-honolulu-after-trip-to-midway-atoll/ |date=September 1, 2016 |title=President Obama lands in Honolulu after trip to Midway Atoll |publisher=[[KHON-TV]] |accessdate=September 2, 2016}}{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/video/2016/09/02/obama-departs-for-g20-in-china?videoId=369741753 |publisher=[[Reuters]] |date=September 2, 2016 |title=Obama departs for G20 in China |accessdate=September 4, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|China}} [[China]] | [[Hangzhou]] | September 3–5 | President Obama traveled to China to attend the [[2016 G-20 Hangzhou summit|G-20 summit meeting]] in Hangzhou, Zhejiang, arriving at [[Hangzhou Xiaoshan International Airport]].{{cite news |publisher=[[National Public Radio]] |url=https://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2016/09/03/492554660/g-20-confrontation-u-s-china-have-tense-exchange-on-the-tarmac-ahead-of-summit |title=G-20 Confrontation: U.S., China Have Tense Exchange On The Tarmac Ahead Of Summit |date=September 3, 2016 |first=Brakkton |last=Booker |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160904184051/http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2016/09/03/492554660/g-20-confrontation-u-s-china-have-tense-exchange-on-the-tarmac-ahead-of-summit |archive-date=September 4, 2016}}[https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2016/09/03/world/asia/ap-as-obama-china-tarmac-tensions.html Bumpy Beginning for Obama in China, Starting on the Tarmac], Associated Press (September 4, 2016). President Obama and President [[Xi Jinping]] of China committed their two nations to a [[climate change]] agreement, "offering a rare display of harmony in a relationship that has become increasingly discordant."Mark Landler & Jane Perlez, [https://www.nytimes.com/2016/09/04/world/asia/obama-xi-jinping-china-climate-accord.html Rare Harmony as China and U.S. Commit to Climate Deal], ''New York Times'' (September 3, 2016). Obama also met with British Prime Minister [[Theresa May]] and Turkish President [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]] during the summit.{{cite news|last1=Liptak|first1=Kevin|title=G20 in China: Syria, Brexit on Obama's agenda|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2016/09/03/politics/obama-china-theresa-may-putin-erdogan/|accessdate=September 6, 2016|work=[[CNN]]|date=September 4, 2016}} Obama and Russian President [[Vladimir Putin]] met on the sidelines of the conference, having a "candid, blunt and businesslike" 90-minute exchange on the [[Syrian Civil War]] (following up on the weeks of prior negotiations on the issue between U.S. Secretary of State [[John Kerry]] and Russian foreign minister [[Sergey Lavrov]]).{{cite news|last1=Buncombe|first1=Andrew|title=President Obama says G20 Syria meeting with Putin was ‘candid, blunt and businesslike’|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/president-obama-says-g20-syria-meeting-with-putin-was-candid-blunt-and-businesslike-a7227081.html|accessdate=September 6, 2016|work=[[The Independent]]|date=September 6, 2016}} However, Obama and Putin were ultimately unable to come to an agreement to advance the [[Syrian peace process]].{{cite news|last1=Wintour|first1=Patrick|title=Peace talks between US and Russia over Syria stall at G20 summit|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/sep/04/syria-peace-talks-us-and-russia-stall-g20|accessdate=September 6, 2016|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=September 4, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|Laos}} New York City | September 18–21 | President Obama met with Iraqi Prime Minister [[Haider al-Abadi]] on Monday, September 19, to discuss military progress against [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant|ISIL]]. In a press statement, the President also responded to the [[2016 New York and New Jersey bombings|New York and New Jersey bombings]] that occurred nearby. On Tuesday, Barack Obama addressed the [[United Nations General Assembly]].{{cite news |first=Mark|last=Landler|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/09/17/us/politics/united-nations-obama-clinton.html?_r=0 |publisher=''[[The New York Times]]'' |date=September 16, 2016 |title=U.N. Meeting a Farewell for Obama, and a Dress Rehearsal for Clinton }} After speaking at the UN, Obama co-hosted a meeting along with leaders from [[Canada]], [[Ethiopia]], [[Germany]], [[Jordan]], [[Mexico]] and [[Sweden]] along with [[United Nations Secretary General]] [[Ban Ki-moon]], and attended by many other nations, at a Leaders Summit on Refugees. Obama and other leaders spoke on the needs of international [[refugees]], and encouraged nations to take in more families fleeing war zones around the world.{{cite news |first=Laura|last=Koran|url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/09/20/politics/obama-refugees-summit/ |publisher=''[[CNN]]'' |date=September 20, 2016 |title=Obama leads summit to aid refugees }} On Wednesday, President Obama met with Israeli Prime Minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu]], marking the final meeting between the two as leaders. Obama and Netanyahu discussed the state of U.S./Israeli relations and the state of the [[Israeli–Palestinian peace process]]. Netanyahu invited President Obama to visit [[Israel]] after he leaves office.{{cite news |first=Mark|last=Landler|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/09/22/world/middleeast/obama-netanyahu-israel-palestinians.html?_r=0 |publisher=The New York Times |date=September 21, 2016 |title=After Much Obama also voted at the Cook County Office Building.{{cite news|title=Obama campaigns, votes in Chicago |url=http://www.reviewjournal.com/politics/election-2016/obama-campaigns-votes-chicago |archive-date=October 8, 2016 |date=October 7, 2016 |publisher=''[[Las Vegas Review-Journal]]'' |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161008050830/http://www.reviewjournal.com/politics/election-2016/obama-campaigns-votes-chicago |deadurl=yes |df= }} Obama will also attend a campaign event for Congresswoman [[Tammy Duckworth]].{{cite news|last=Sweet|first=Lynn|url=http://chicago.suntimes.com/politics/obama-guidance-press-schedule-oct-1-2-2016-chicago-next-week/ |date=October 1, 2016 |title=Obama guidance, press schedule Oct. 1, 2, 2016. Chicago next week |publisher=[[Chicago Sun-Times]]|accessdate=October 2, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|North Carolina}} ''[[North Carolina]]'' | [[Greensboro, North Carolina|Greensboro]] | October 11 | President Obama traveled to Greensboro, North Carolina, arriving at [[Piedmont Triad International Airport]]. Obama participated in a town hall style discussion at [[North Carolina A&T State University]], hosted by sports network [[ESPN]], and took questions regarding the [[My Brother's Keeper Challenge]], and the role of black colleges and universities. Barack Obama then attended a campaign event, and delivered remarks in support of Hillary Clinton's presidential campaign. The president delivered the remarks at [[Greensboro Coliseum Complex]]'s White Oak Amphitheatre before returning to Washington.{{cite news |first=Lynn|last=Sweet|title=Obama guidance, press schedule Oc. 11, 2016. Brother’s Keeper |url=http://chicago.suntimes.com/news/obama-guidance-press-schedule-oc-11-2016-brothers-keeper/ |date=October 11, 2016 |publisher=''[[Chicago Sun-Times]]''}} President Obama traveled to North Carolina one day after declaring the state a federal disaster area, following the damage caused by [[Hurricane Matthew]] there.{{cite web |first=Pam|last=Wright|title=Flooding From Matthew Kills 14 in North Carolina; 'Too Many People Have Died,' Governor Says |url=https://weather.com/news/news/hurricane-matthew-north-carolina-update |date=October 11, 2016 |publisher=''[[The Weather Channel]]''}} |- | {{flagicon|Pennsylvania}} ''[[Pennsylvania]]'' | [[Pittsburgh]] | October 13 | President Obama traveled to Pittsburgh, arriving at [[Pittsburgh International Airport]]. Obama was given a tour of the White House Frontiers Conference at the [[University of Pittsburgh]]. Later, Obama delivered remarks during the same conference at the Jared L. Cohon University Center at [[Carnegie Mellon University]].{{cite news |first=Lynn|last=Sweet|title=Obama guidance, press schedule Oct. 13, 2016. Stumping in Ohio |url=http://chicago.suntimes.com/news/obama-guidance-press-schedule-oct-13-2016-stumping-in-ohio/ |date=October 12, 2016 |accessdate=October 13, 2016| publisher=''[[Chicago Sun-Times]]''}}{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.com/news/local_news/obama-speaks-at-carnegie-mellon/collection_20fa20f4-919c-11e6-ad37-b79af00d69a9.html#5 |title=Obama speaks at Carnegie Mellon |date=October 13, 2016 |publisher=''[[Beaver County Times]]'' |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161019152847/http://www.timesonline.com/news/local_news/obama-speaks-at-carnegie-mellon/collection_20fa20f4-919c-11e6-ad37-b79af00d69a9.html |archive-date=October 19, 2016 |deadurl=yes |df= }} |- | {{flagicon|Ohio}} ''[[Ohio]]'' | [[Columbus, Ohio|Columbus]],
[[Cleveland]] | October 13–14 | President Obama traveled to Columbus, Ohio, after leaving Pittsburgh, arriving at [[John Glenn Columbus International Airport]]. Barack Obama spoke at a political event for the [[Ohio Democratic Party]], and in support of former Governor [[Ted Strickland]]'s [[United States Senate election in Ohio, 2016|campaign for U.S. Senate]] at the [[Greater Columbus Convention Center]]. Later, Obama traveled to Cleveland, arriving at [[Cleveland Hopkins International Airport]]. President Obama remained overnight in Cleveland, and then campaigned for Hillary Clinton's presidential campaign as well as other Democrats during a series of television, radio and other speeches.{{cite news |first=Juliet|last=Eilperin|title=In Ohio, Obama seeks to hand over his winning coalition to Clinton |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-politics/wp/2016/10/14/in-ohio-obama-seeks-to-hand-over-his-winning-coalition-to-clinton/ |date=October 14, 2016 |accessdate=October 14, 2016| publisher=''[[Washington Post]]''}} |- | {{flagicon|Florida}} ''[[Florida]]'' | [[Miami]],
[[Miami Gardens, Florida|Miami Gardens]] | October 20 | President Obama traveled to Miami, Florida, to speak at [[Miami Dade College]] on the [[Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act]]. Obama also campaigned for Hillary Clinton's presidential campaign.{{cite news|last=Sweet|first=Lynn|url=http://chicago.suntimes.com/news/obama-guidance-press-schedule-oct-15-16-2016-italy-pm-coming/ |date=October 15, 2016 |title=Obama guidance, press schedule Oct. 15, 16, 2016. Italy PM coming |publisher=[[Chicago Sun-Times]]|accessdate=October 15, 2016}} President Obama then spoke at [[Florida Memorial University]] in nearby Miami Gardens, campaigning for U.S. Senate candidate [[Patrick Murphy (Florida politician)|Patrick Murphy]] as well as [[Hillary Clinton]].{{cite news|last=Iglesias|first=Jose|url=http://www.miamiherald.com/news/politics-government/election/hillary-clinton/article109480062.html |date=October 20, 2016 |title=Obama in Miami: Trashing Trump, ripping Rubio |publisher=[[Miami Herald]]|accessdate=October 20, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|Nevada}} ''[[Nevada]]'' | [[Las Vegas]] | October 23 | President Obama traveled to Las Vegas, Nevada, to campaign for Hillary Clinton's presidential campaign, as well as [[Catherine Cortez Masto]], who is running to represent the State of Nevada in her bid to [[United States Senate election in Nevada, 2016|replace the retiring Harry Reid in the U.S. Senate]].{{cite news|last=Botkin|first=Ben|title=President Obama to campaign for Hillary Clinton and Catherine Cortez Masto on Sunday in Las Vegas |publisher=[[Las Vegas Review-Journal]]|accessdate=October 21, 2016}} Obama held a rally at Cheyenne High School in [[North Las Vegas]].{{cite news|title=Obama encourages crowd to vote for Clinton, down-ballot candidates, during North Las Vegas rally |publisher=''[[Las Vegas Review-Journal]]'' |date=October 23, 2016 |first=Ben |last=Botkin |url=http://www.reviewjournal.com/politics/obama-encourages-crowd-vote-clinton-down-ballot-candidates-during-north-las-vegas-rally |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161027135005/http://www.reviewjournal.com/politics/obama-encourages-crowd-vote-clinton-down-ballot-candidates-during-north-las-vegas-rally |archive-date=October 27, 2016 |deadurl=yes |df= }} |- | {{flagicon|California}} ''[[California]]'' | [[San Diego]],
[[Los Angeles]] | October 24–25 | President Obama traveled to California, to campaign for Hillary Clinton's presidential campaign as well to a private meeting with a Hollywood group to raise money for her presidential campaign. Obama also taped an appearance on ''[[Jimmy Kimmel Live!]]''.{{cite news|last1=Hicks|first1=Tony|title=President Obama reads mean tweets on ‘Jimmy Kimmel Live!’|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/2016/10/25/president-obama-reads-mean-tweets-on-jimmy-kimmel-live/|accessdate=October 26, 2016|work=[[San Jose Mercury News]]|date=October 25, 2016}} Departing from [[McCarran International Airport]], the President arrived at [[Marine Corps Air Station Miramar]] in [[Miramar, San Diego]].{{cite news|publisher=''[[Times of San Diego]]'' |title=Obama Thrills WWII Vet at Miramar, Lashes Rep. Issa in La Jolla for ‘Chutzpah’ |first=Ken |last=Stone |date=October 23, 2016 |url=https://timesofsandiego.com/politics/2016/10/23/obama-thrills-wwii-vet-at-miramar-lashes-rep-issa-in-la-jolla-for-chutzpah/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161027140617/https://timesofsandiego.com/politics/2016/10/23/obama-thrills-wwii-vet-at-miramar-lashes-rep-issa-in-la-jolla-for-chutzpah/ |archive-date=October 27, 2016 |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{cite news|url=http://www.greenwichtime.com/news/article/Obama-leaves-Nevada-after-rallying-for-Clinton-10154901.php#photo-11603755 |title=Obama leaves Nevada after rallying for Clinton, Dems |date=October 24, 2016 |publisher=''[[Greenwich Time (newspaper)|Greenwich Time]]'' |author=[[The Associated Press]] |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161027140318/http://www.greenwichtime.com/news/article/Obama-leaves-Nevada-after-rallying-for-Clinton-10154901.php |archive-date=October 27, 2016 |deadurl=yes |df= }} Obama attended campaign events in San Diego and Los Angeles for two days.{{cite news|last1=Freking|first=Kevin|last2=Lederman|first2=Josh|title=Obama increasingly looks to boost down-ballot Democrats |publisher=[[Associated Press]]|date=October 24, 2016}} |- | {{flagicon|Florida}} ''[[Florida]]'' | [[Orlando]] | October 28 | President Obama traveled to Orlando, Florida, to campaign for Hillary Clinton's presidential campaign.{{cite news|title=Obama to campaign for Hillary Clinton Thursday in Jacksonville|url=http://www.news4jax.com/news/local/jacksonville/obama-to-campaign-for-hillary-clinton-thursday-in-jacksonville|accessdate=October 28, 2016|work=[[WJXT]]|date=October 28, 2016}} |} == November == {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country/

Before introducing her, the president gave a speech in support of Clinton, and other [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] candidates. Obama was joined on stage by his wife [[Michelle Obama|Michelle]], as well as [[Bill Clinton|Bill]] and [[Chelsea Clinton]]. [[Jon Bon Jovi]] and [[Bruce Springsteen]] performed during the event.{{cite news|first1=Maggie|last1=Haberman|first2=Alan|last2=Rappeport|title=Presidential Election: The Day Before the [[List of international presidential trips made by Barack Obama|overseas trip as president]]. He met with [[Greek Prime Minister]] [[Alexis Tsipras]] and [[President of Greece|President]] [[Prokopis Pavlopoulos]] to discuss the [[Greek government-debt crisis]], the [[European migrant crisis]], and their [[NATO]] alliance.{{cite web|author1=[[Ben Rhodes (White House staffer)|Rhodes, Ben]]|title=The President Abroad: A Look Ahead at Greece, Germany, and Peru|url=https://medium.com/the-white-house/the-president-abroad-a-look-ahead-at-greece-germany-and-peru-265b9c00a94e#.k789x9vn7|website=[[Medium (website)|Medium]]|publisher=A Medium Corporation|accessdate=November 16, 2016}} Obama delivered a "legacy speech" at the [[Stavros Niarchos Foundation Cultural Center]], covering the impact of [[democracy]] and the country's government-debt crisis, emphasizing the need for [[debt relief]], and attended a [[state dinner]] at the [[Presidential Mansion, Athens|Presidential Mansion]].{{cite news |title=Obama urges nations not to give in to isolationist impulses |first=Josh |last=Lederman |url=http://www.kwwl.com/story/33720904/obama-to-tour-ancient-greek-acropolis |date=November 16, 2016 |quote=President Barack Obama and Greek President Prokopis Pavlopoulos, right, greet guest as they make their way to their seats to begin a State Dinner at the Presidential Mansion |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161117031903/http://www.kwwl.com/story/33720904/obama-to-tour-ancient-greek-acropolis |archive-date=November 17, 2016 |publisher=[[KWWL (TV)|KWWL]]}}{{cite news|last1=Maltezou|first1=Renee|title=Obama says confident U.S. will continue commitment to NATO|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-obama-greece-nato-idUSKBN13B1KZ|accessdate=November 16, 2016|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=November 16, 2016}} While in Athens, he also toured the [[Acropolis of Athens|Acropolis]] and the [[Acropolis Museum]].{{cite news|last1=Becatoros|first1=Elena|last2=Lederman|first2=Josh|title=Obama tours ancient Greek Acropolis|url=http://www.seattletimes.com/nation-world/obama-to-tour-ancient-greek-acropolis/|accessdate=November 16, 2016|agency=[[Associated Press]]|via=''[[The Seattle Times]]''|date=November 15, 2016}}{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3941510/Next-time-ll-just-tourist-foreign-visit-President-Barack-Obama-feels-hand-history-Greece.html |title='The only way forward is democracy... even though you don't always win!' Obama tries to look on the bright side in the wake of Trump's election victory as he gives a speech in the birthplace of democracy |first1=Chris |last1=Summers |date=November 16, 2016 |publisher=''[[The Daily Mail]]'' |archive-url=http://arquivo.pt/wayback/20161116202430/http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article%2D3941510/Next%2Dtime%2Dll%2Djust%2Dtourist%2Dforeign%2Dvisit%2DPresident%2DBarack%2DObama%2Dfeels%2Dhand%2Dhistory%2DGreece.html |archive-date=November 16, 2016 |deadurl=yes |df= }} |- |{{flagicon|Germany}} [[Germany]] |[[Berlin]] |November 16–18 |President Obama traveled to Berlin for the meeting with European leaders of the "[[NATO Quint|Quint]]": [[German Chancellor]] [[Angela Merkel]], [[French President]] [[François Hollande]], [[British Prime Minister]] [[Theresa May]], [[Italian Prime Minister]] [[Matteo Renzi]], and [[Spanish Prime Minister]] [[Mariano Rajoy]], in the final such meeting of his presidency. The leaders discussed trade, the [[Ukrainian crisis]], the [[Syrian Civil War]], and [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]].{{cite news|title=Statement by the Press Secretary on the President's Travel to Greece, Germany, and Peru|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2016/10/25/statement-press-secretary-presidents-travel-greece-germany-and-peru|publisher=[[White House Office of the Press Secretary]]|date=October 25, 2016}} President Obama had a private dinner at the [[Hotel Adlon]] with Chancellor Merkel.{{cite news |url=http://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2016/11/18/world/politics-diplomacy-world/obama-trump-dont-take-realpolitik-tack-toward-putin-just-cut-deals/ |publisher=''[[The Japan Times]]'' |quote=German Chancellor Angela Merkel and U.S. President Barack Obama talk during their dinner at the Hotel Adlon in Berlin Thursday |date=November 18, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161118015021/http://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2016/11/18/world/politics-diplomacy-world/obama-trump-dont-take-realpolitik-tack-toward-putin-just-cut-deals/ |archive-date=November 18, 2016 |title=Obama to Trump: Don’t take realpolitik tack toward Putin and just cut deals}}{{cite news |title=Berliners react to Obama's last presidential visit |url=http://www.dw.com/en/berliners-react-to-obamas-last-presidential-visit/a-36431625 |publisher=[[Deutsche Welle]] |date=November 17, 2016 |quote=Fencing has been set up around Pariser Platz. Obama is staying at the Hotel Adlon, which is situated on the square, as is the US Embassy. |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161118015251/http://www.dw.com/en/berliners-react-to-obamas-last-presidential-visit/a-36431625 |archive-date=November 18, 2016}} |- |{{flagicon|Portugal}} [[Portugal]] |[[Azores]] |November 18 |During an [[Air Force One]] refueling stop, President Obama briefly left the airplane to stretch on the tarmac at [[Lajes Air Base]].{{cite news |publisher=[[Channel NewsAsia]] |url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/business/pacific-rim-leaders-eye-china-lead-on-trade-after-trump-win/3301500.html |title=Pacific rim leaders eye China lead on trade after Trump win |date=November 19, 2016 |quote=U.S. President Barack Obama passes an engine while stretching his legs on the tarmac during an Air Force One refueling stop in Lajes Air Base in the Azores, Portugal |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119032719/http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/business/pacific-rim-leaders-eye-china-lead-on-trade-after-trump-win/3301500.html |archive-date=November 19, 2016}}{{cite tweet |user=markknoller |title=Pres Obama stretches his legs on the tarmac at Lajes Field in the Azores on refueling stop en route Peru. (TV pool photo by @ArletteSaenz) |number=799663482748604416 |date=November 18, 2016}}{{cite news |first=Peter |publisher=[[Instagram]] |last=Souza |title=President Obama surveys the landscape just off the tarmac at Lajes Air Base, Azores, during a refueling stop en route from Germany to Peru. My grandparents are from the Azores, a group of nine Portuguese islands, in the Atlantic. Political Director David Simas and Energy Secretary Ernie Moniz also trace their roots to the Azores. |url=https://www.instagram.com/p/BM9jj02jOOf/ |accessdate=November 18, 2016}} |- |{{flagicon|Peru}} [[Peru]] |[[Lima]] |November 18–20 |President Obama traveled to Peru to attend the [[APEC Peru 2016|APEC Economic Leaders' Meeting]] in Lima, his last international trip as President, arriving at [[Jorge Chávez International Airport]]. {{cite news |author= |title=The Latest: Obama reporters separated from motorcade |url=https://apnews.com/c45d2d2347244d6eb4fd900afac9b8ff |work=The Associated Press |location= |date=November 19, 2016 |access-date=November 13, 2018}} President Obama also hosted a Young Leaders of the Americas Initiative town hall at the [[Pontifical Catholic University of Peru]].{{cite news |url=http://latino.foxnews.com/latino/politics/2016/11/19/obama-does-not-foresee-trump-making-big-changes-in-us-policy-toward-latam/ |title=Obama does not foresee Trump making big changes in U.S. policy toward LatAm |publisher=[[Fox News Latino]] |date=November 19, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161120185554/http://latino.foxnews.com/latino/politics/2016/11/19/obama-does-not-foresee-trump-making-big-changes-in-us-policy-toward-latam/ |archive-date=November 20, 2016}}{{Cite news |title=Obama Claims Trump Will Continue Status Quo for Latin America |url=http://www.telesurtv.net/english/news/Obama-Claims-Trump-Will-Continue-Status-Quo-for-Latin-America-20161120-0006.html |publisher=[[TeleSUR]] |date=November 20, 2016 |archive-date=November 20, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161120185826/http://www.telesurtv.net/english/news/Obama-Claims-Trump-Will-Continue-Status-Quo-for-Latin-America-20161120-0006.html}} On the sidelines of the summit, he held bilateral meetings with [[President of the People's Republic of China|Chinese President]] [[Xi Jinping]], [[Australian Prime Minister]] [[Malcolm Turnbull]] and [[Canadian Prime Minister]] [[Justin Trudeau]]. |- |{{flagicon|Maryland}} ''[[Maryland]]'' |[[Bethesda, Maryland|Bethesda]] |November 29 |President Obama visited wounded soldiers at [[Walter Reed National Military Medical Center]], awarding twelve [[Purple Heart]] decorations.{{cite news |url=http://www.stltoday.com/news/national/obama-visits-wounded-at-walter-reed/article_634677a0-35b1-53b6-a5ce-d5852aa37810.html |title=Obama visits wounded at Walter Reed |first=Kevin |last=Freking |publisher=''[[St. Louis Post-Dispatch]]'' |date=November 29, 2016 |archive-date=November 30, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161130022518/http://www.stltoday.com/news/national/obama-visits-wounded-at-walter-reed/article_634677a0-35b1-53b6-a5ce-d5852aa37810.html}}{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/29/us/politics/obama-walter-reed-military.html |title=Obama’s Sacred Duty: Visiting the Wounded at Walter Reed |first=Gardiner |last=Harris |date=November 29, 2016 |accessdate=November 29, 2016 |publisher=''[[The New York Times]]''}} |} == December == {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=100|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flagicon|Florida}} ''[[Florida]]'' |[[Tampa]] |December 6 |President Obama traveled to [[MacDill Air Force Base]] outside of [[Tampa, Florida]], delivering his final speech on national security at the base's Hangar 1.{{cite news|url=http://www.dw.com/en/us-president-obama-makes-final-national-security-speech-at-macdill-air-force-base/a-36672171 |title=US President Obama makes final national security speech at MacDill Air Force Base |publisher=''[[Deutsche Welle]]'' |date=December 7, 2016 |archive-date=December 7, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161207164550/http://www.dw.com/en/us-president-obama-makes-final-national-security-speech-at-macdill-air-force-base/a-36672171 |quote=Speaking to troops at the MacDill Air Force Base, home to US Special Operations Command and Central Command in Florida on Tuesday, Obama said the fight against terror should not come at the expense of civil rights and US democratic traditions. |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{cite news|url=http://www.defense.gov/News/Article/Article/1022582/president-thanks-macdill-troops-families-for-their-service-to-nation |publisher=[[United States Department of Defense]] |first=Terri Moon |last=Cronk |title=President Thanks MacDill Troops, Families for Their Service to Nation |date=December 7, 2017 |archive-date=December 7, 2016 |quote=President Barack Obama addresses members of Team MacDill during his visit to MacDill Air Force Base, Florida, Dec. 6, 2016. The president thanked the service members and spoke on counterterrorism measures, national security and highlighted accomplishments of the U.S. military. |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161207164445/http://www.defense.gov/News/Article/Article/1022582/president-thanks-macdill-troops-families-for-their-service-to-nation |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{cite news|url=http://live.tampabay.com/Event/President_Obama_in_Tampa |title=President Obama in Tampa |publisher=''[[Tampa Bay Times]]'' |date=December 6, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161207170347/http://live.tampabay.com/Event/President_Obama_in_Tampa |archive-date=December 7, 2016 |deadurl=yes |df= }} |- |{{flagicon|Hawaii}} ''[[Hawaii]]'' |[[Kailua, Hawaii County, Hawaii|Kailua]], [[Kaneohe, Hawaii|Kāneʻohe]], [[Waimānalo, Hawaii|Waimānalo]], [[Honolulu]], [[Kapolei, Hawaii|Kapolei]], [[Aiea, Hawaii|ʻAiea]] |December 16 – January 2, 2017 |President Obama and the First Family traveled to Hawaii for their annual vacation, arriving at [[Joint Base Pearl Harbor-Hickam]], where he met with [[United States Senate|Senator]] [[Brian Schatz]], [[Governor of Hawaii|Governor]] [[David Ige]], [[Mayor of Honolulu]] [[Kirk Caldwell]] and the Commander of [[United States Pacific Command]], Admiral [[Harry B. Harris Jr.]]{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4043618/The-Obamas-arrive-Hawaii-final-vacation-Family.html |title=Final First Family vacation! The Obamas leave the troubles - and chilly weather - of DC behind to celebrate Christmas in Hawaii |publisher=''[[The Daily Mail]]'' |date=December 17, 2016 |first=Anneta |last=Konstantinides |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161217180852/http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4043618/The-Obamas-arrive-Hawaii-final-vacation-Family.html |archive-date=December 17, 2016 |quote=Obama and Malia walked hand in hand as they walked down the stairs to meet Hawaii Sen. Brian Schatz, Governor David Ige, Mayor Kirk Caldwell and US Pacific Fleet commander Adm Harry Harris.}} The President later visited [[Marine Corps Base Hawaii]], where he played [[golf]] at the Kaneohe Klipper Golf Course.{{cite news|url=http://www.hawaiinewsnow.com/story/34081124/obama-spends-first-day-of-hawaii-vacation-playing-golf |publisher=[[Hawaii News Now]] |date=December 18, 2016 |first=Jobeth |last=Devera |title=On first full day in Hawaii, Obama hits the links with friends |quote=Obama spent four hours Saturday playing with friends at Kaneohe Klipper Golf Course inside Marine Corps Base Hawaii. |archive-date=December 18, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161218180339/http://www.hawaiinewsnow.com/story/34081124/obama-spends-first-day-of-hawaii-vacation-playing-golf |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{cite news|title=The Latest: Obama tees off vacation with round of golf |author=[[The Associated Press]] |publisher=''[[San Antonio Express-News]]'' |date=December 17, 2016 |quote=On the first day of his Hawaii vacation, President Barack Obama is playing golf with three aides and a longtime friend. The presidential fivesome is enjoying temperatures in the 70s at Klipper Golf Club inside Marine Corps Base Hawaii on the island of Oahu, where Obama was born. |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161218180351/http://www.mysanantonio.com/news/article/The-Latest-Obama-tees-off-vacation-with-round-of-10803388.php |archive-date=December 18, 2016 |url=http://www.mysanantonio.com/news/article/The-Latest-Obama-tees-off-vacation-with-round-of-10803388.php |deadurl=yes |df= }} The President later visited the [[Ho'omaluhia Botanical Garden]] in [[Kaneohe, Hawaii|Kāneʻohe]].{{cite news |title=President takes stroll in rainy, green enclave |author=[[The Associated Press]] |publisher=''[[Honolulu Star-Advertiser]]'' |url=http://www.staradvertiser.com/2016/12/19/hawaii-news/president-takes-stroll-in-rainy-green-enclave |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220024818/http://www.staradvertiser.com/2016/12/19/hawaii-news/president-takes-stroll-in-rainy-green-enclave/ |archive-date=December 20, 2016 |quote=President Barack Obama began the second day of his annual Hawaii holiday vacation Sunday with a wet midmorning walk at Ho'omaluhia Botanical Garden on Oahu's Windward side.}} The President and the First Family subsequently visited the beach at [[Bellows Air Force Station]].{{cite news |url=http://kwbe.com/abc_politics/president-obamas-final-hawaiian-vacation-as-president-abcid35829554/ |title=President Obama’s Final Hawaiian Vacation as President |publisher=[[KWBE]] |date=December 20, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161221114024/http://kwbe.com/abc_politics/president-obamas-final-hawaiian-vacation-as-president-abcid35829554/ |archive-date=December 21, 2016 |author=[[ABC News]] |quote=The Obama family went to Bellows Air Force station to visit the beach with friends. It is a favorite beach spot for the first family; last year, the first family visited the beach three times, and in 2014, they made it there five times.}}{{cite news |title=POTUS Press Pool Prose |first=Chad |last=Blair |url=http://www.civilbeat.org/2016/12/potus-press-pool-prose/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161221114314/http://www.civilbeat.org/2016/12/potus-press-pool-prose/ |archive-date=December 21, 2016 |date=December 20, 2016 |quote=The first family and their friends are spending the afternoon at the beach at Bellows Air Force Base.}} On December 21, the President golfed at the Kapolei Golf Club and dined at Buzz's Lanikai in [[Kapolei, Hawaii]].{{cite news|publisher=[[ABC News]] |author=[[The Associated Press]] |title=The Latest: Obamas, Friends Dine Near Hawaii Vacation Home |quote=President Obama and his family wrapped up another day of their Hawaii holiday vacation with dinner at a restaurant near their Kailua vacation home. The first family and some friends dined Wednesday night at Buzz's Lanikai, just a short motorcade trip away and situated across a road from Kailua Beach. |url=http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/wireStory/latest-obama-begins-5th-day-vacation-workout-44327833 |date=December 22, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161222153944/http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/wireStory/latest-obama-begins-5th-day-vacation-workout-44327833 |archive-date=December 22, 2016 |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{cite news |title=The Latest: Obama Finishes Playing Golf With 3 Friends |author=[[The Associated Press]] |publisher=[[ABC News]] |date=December 21, 2016 |url=http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/wireStory/latest-obama-begins-5th-day-vacation-workout-44327833 |quote=Wearing a white shirt and dark-colored shorts and a baseball hat, President Barack Obama finished 18 holes of golf at the Kapolei Golf Course in Kapolei, Hawaii. It took about five hours for the president and his playing partners — Bobby Titcomb, Greg Orme, and Darrell Harrington — to finish the round.}}{{cite news |url=http://www.hawaiinewsnow.com/story/34111164/obama-plays-18-holes-at-a-kapolei-course |title=Obama plays 18 holes at a Kapolei course |publisher=[[Hawaii News Now]] |quote=Obama played all 18 holes at the Kapolei Golf Course with close friends Bobby Titcomb, Greg Orme, and Darrell Harrington |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161222034354/http://www.hawaiinewsnow.com/story/34111164/obama-plays-18-holes-at-a-kapolei-course |archive-date=December 22, 2016 |date=December 21, 2016 }} On December 24, the President and his daughters played the "Breakout Waikiki" [[escape room]] game in [[Waikīkī]], [[Honolulu]].{{cite news |url=http://thehill.com/blogs/blog-briefing-room/news/311784-obamas-go-to-escape-room-game-on-christmas-eve |work=[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]] |title=Obamas go to 'escape room' game on Christmas Eve |first=Elliot |last=Smilowitz |date=December 25, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161226043906/http://thehill.com/blogs/blog-briefing-room/news/311784-obamas-go-to-escape-room-game-on-christmas-eve |archive-date=December 26, 2016 |quote=According to pool reports, Obama took his daughters and friends Saturday night to Breakout Waikiki, a game where players are locked into a room with one hour to figure out a series of clues and riddles to escape.}}{{cite news |url=https://www.yahoo.com/news/obamas-play-christmas-eve-escape-game-trumps-attend-183116989.html |title=Obamas play Christmas Eve escape game; Trumps attend late night service |publisher=''[[Yahoo News]]'' |date=December 25, 2016 |author=[[Agence France-Presse]] |quote=President Barack Obama and his daughters spent part of the Christmas weekend playing an 'escape room' game, while White House successor Donald Trump ushered in the holiday overnight with a visit to church. According to pool reports, Obama, daughters Sasha and Malia and some friends spent part of Saturday evening playing 'Breakout Waikiki' -- a live-action game where players are locked in a room with one hour to figure out a series of clues and riddles to escape. |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161226044224/https://www.yahoo.com/news/obamas-play-christmas-eve-escape-game-trumps-attend-183116989.html |archive-date=December 26, 2016}} On December 27, the President laid a wreath at the [[USS Arizona Memorial|USS ''Arizona'' Memorial]] with [[Prime Minister of Japan|Japanese Prime Minister]] [[Shinzō Abe]].{{cite news |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161227231723/http://asia.nikkei.com/Politics-Economy/International-Relations/Obama-Abe-lay-wreaths-at-USS-Arizona-Memorial |url=http://asia.nikkei.com/Politics-Economy/International-Relations/Obama-Abe-lay-wreaths-at-USS-Arizona-Memorial |title=Obama, Abe lay wreaths at USS Arizona Memorial |date=January 28, 2016 |quote=After arriving at Pearl Harbor, Abe and Obama took a brief boat ride to the USS Arizona Memorial, built on top of the sunken battleship. They laid a pair of wreaths in front of the marbled wall with names of U.S. troops who lost their lives. The two leaders then bowed their heads slightly and stood for a moment of silence. |publisher=''[[Nikkei Asian Review]]'' |archive-date=December 27, 2016}} The two leaders later spoke at [[Joint Base Pearl Harbor-Hickam]], following a meeting earlier in the morning at [[Camp H. M. Smith]].{{cite news |url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/ct-pearl-harbor-shinzo-abe-president-obama-20161227-story.html |publisher=''[[Chicago Tribune]]'' |date=December 27, 2016 |title=Japan's Abe offers 'everlasting condolences' in visit to Pearl Harbor with Obama |quote=Afterward, they spoke at nearby Joint Base Pearl Harbor-Hickam, where Obama called the harbor a sacred place and said that "even the deepest wounds of war can give way to friendship and lasting peace." |accessdate=December 27, 2016}}{{cite news |title=Abe Answers Obama’s Hiroshima Visit With Pearl Harbor Trip |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/politics/articles/2016-12-27/abe-to-answer-obama-s-hiroshima-visit-with-trip-to-pearl-harbor |date=December 27, 2016 |first1=Toluse |last1=Olorunnipa |first2=Isabel |last2=Reynolds |first3=Justin |last3=Sink |publisher=[[Bloomberg News]] |quote=Abe and Obama met for likely the last time before President-elect Donald Trump is inaugurated at Camp H.M. Smith, a Marine Corps installation on the Hawaiian island of Oahu. The two leaders then traveled by motorcade and boat to the memorial to the U.S.S. Arizona, a battleship sunk in the attack, where they laid a pair of lily wreaths that said “in remembrance.” They then tossed flower petals into the waters over the Arizona. |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161228040657/https://www.bloomberg.com/politics/articles/2016-12-27/abe-to-answer-obama-s-hiroshima-visit-with-trip-to-pearl-harbor |archive-date=December 28, 2016}} Following the visit to Pearl Harbor, the President and the First Family went [[snorkeling]] at [[Hanauma Bay|Hanauma Bay State Park]].{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2016/12/27/us/ap-us-obama-vacation-the-latest.html |author=[[The Associated Press]] |publisher=''[[New York Times]]'' |date=December 27, 2016 |accessdate=December 27, 2016 |quote=President Barack Obama is spending the afternoon snorkeling following his visit to Pearl Harbor with Japan's prime minister. The White House says Obama, his family and friends are snorkeling at Hanauma Bay State Park. Obama's motorcade pulled up early afternoon as waves crashed into the cliffs. |title=The Latest: Obama Goes Snorkeling After Pearl Harbor Visit }} |} == See also == * [[Timeline of the presidency of Barack Obama (2016)]] == References == {{reflist|30em}} {{Barack Obama}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Presidential Trips Made By Barack Obama during 2016}} [[Category:2016 in the United States]] [[Category:Presidential travels of Barack Obama]] [[Category:Lists of events in the United States]] [[Category:Geography-related lists]] [[Category:2016-related lists]] [[Category:2016 in international relations]]

page.title: List of religious centers in Tehran

revision.text:
This is a list of religious centers in [[Tehran]], Iran. {{Refimprove|date=February 2017}}
==Religious centers== [[Image:Hoseiniyeh Ershad.jpg|thumb|right|250px|[[Hosseiniye Ershad|Hosseinieh Ershad]].]] [[File:Haram emamzadeh saleh.jpg|thumb|250px|[[Imamzadeh Saleh, Shemiran]]]] *[[Shahr Banu]] Mausoleum *''Javan-Mard Qassab'' Mausoleum, a pre-Islamic semi-mythical hero *Dozens of [[Imamzadeh]] shrines, hundreds of years old, including that of [[Imam Zadeh Saleh]]. *Dozens of [[Saqa Khaneh]]s: traditional places of prayer *Several [[Tekyeh]]s: traditional places for mourning Muharram ceremonies for [[Husayn ibn Ali]]. *''[[Ebn-e Babooyeh|Ebn-e Babveyh]]'' cemetery, where many Iranian giants such as [[Gholamreza Takhti|Takhti]] and [[Ali Akbar Dehkhoda]] are buried. *''[[Zahir o-dowleh|Zahir-ud-Dowleh]]'' cemetery, in [[Tajrish]], where many Iranian giants of art and culture such as [[Iraj Mirza]], [[Mohammad Taghi Bahar]], [[Forough Farrokhzad]], [[Abolhasan Saba]], [[Ruhollah Khaleghi]], and [[Darvish-Khan]] are buried. *Kordan Tomb, [[Seljuk Turks|Seljuk]] era, [[Karaj]]. *Meidanak Tomb, 13th century, Karaj *The Polish Cemetery 1-north of Tehran in [[Gholhak|Qolhak]], British Embassy Garden, where numerous [[World War II]] western Allied soldiers are buried. 2- Polish Cemetery (Catholic Cemetery) in Dulab, south-east of Tehran *Orthodox Cemetery, Dulab/The Russian Unknown Soldier's Tomb (Cenotaph) is located here with a red star over it * Naghareh Khaneh Tower. Located on a mountain with same name in HaftDastgah District, beside Aminabad Road. Its age is not clear but it is related to the Seljuk era. This tower is the tomb of a Seljuk king. Under the tower you can see other historical ruins (Einanj Dome). This place was a royal cemetery and was used in the early years of the Islamic era.
==Mosques and madrasehs== [[File:Mezquita Shah, Teherán, Irán, 2016-09-17, DD 48.jpg|thumb|250px|[[Shah Mosque (Tehran)]]]] [[File:Sepahsalar Mosque Tehran.jpg|thumb|250px|[[Sepahsalar Mosque]] Tehran in 1960s]] [[File:Tehran Mosque, Palestinian square.jpg|thumb|250px|A Mosque in Tehran]] [[File:نمایشگاه بین المللی -
